openstack%2Fheat~master~I5766edb305b7cfffdcd8943fb6edce7f3e9ff26d,openstack/heat,master,bp/client-plugins,I5766edb305b7cfffdcd8943fb6edce7f3e9ff26d,Move network constraint to neutron plugin,MERGED,2014-06-17 05:57:35.000000000,2014-07-24 11:33:29.000000000,2014-07-24 11:33:28.000000000,19,17,0,100420,ec35f074ccc9c11d8bad3059eaacb5cfe14c4653,97,20,19,4,4571,Steve Baker,steve-stevebaker,"Move network constraint to neutron plugin
This allows exception imports to be encapsulated inside the neutron
plugin, and plugins are likely the most appropriate place for
custom constraints to live.
Change-Id: I5766edb305b7cfffdcd8943fb6edce7f3e9ff26d

openstack%2Fglance~stable%2Ficehouse~I9dd958b904671a7eb95883026e14684469dc52d5,openstack/glance,stable/icehouse,,I9dd958b904671a7eb95883026e14684469dc52d5,debug level logs should not be translated,ABANDONED,2014-07-24 09:44:58.000000000,2014-07-24 10:55:56.000000000,,277,239,4,109230,ad5b158624dbfe4db0e5ad0861f0a71e77fa7733,9,3,1,37,9656,Ihar Hrachyshka,ihrachys,debug level logs should not be translated
According to the OpenStack translation policy available at
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LoggingStandards debug messages
should not be translated. Like mentioned in several changes in
Nova by garyk this is to help prioritize log translation.
This patch adds a new hacking check - N319 - that ensures all
debug log messages don't have translations.
Conflicts:
Closes-Bug: #1317847
(cherry picked from commit 86dd9ff66c0f2b7ded9d94aa8fb2663c28196e23)

openstack%2Ftempest~stable%2Fhavana~I76d19f096d6cb4122eea2e7e5de4eb37b97a4b87,openstack/tempest,stable/havana,bp-62014,I76d19f096d6cb4122eea2e7e5de4eb37b97a4b87,Catch ssh exception and detach in min scenario,ABANDONED,2014-02-08 03:17:07.000000000,2014-07-24 10:38:50.000000000,,1,2,0,72056,4deb10a56400256ed22636e5da0c9b857fb1b5e9,11,3,1,1,2243,John Griffith,john-griffith,Catch ssh exception and detach in min scenario
The test_minimum_basic test goes through a number of tests however
doesn't do any clean up if a failur occurs.  The master clean-up
routine is ok, but it doesn't account for things like attached volumes.
One issue here is that the ssh_to_server times out do to some other
problem and raises an SSHTimeout exception.  This exception isn't dealt
with, the test dumps out and tries to cleanup by deleting the instance
and the volume, but the volume-delete will fail because it's status is
still in-use.
This exposes another problem, it seems that nova delete will clean up
an instance but fairly regular neglect to detach the volume. This patch
add an addCleanup() call to nova.volume_detach.
Change-Id: I76d19f096d6cb4122eea2e7e5de4eb37b97a4b87
Partial-Bug: #1213215
(cherry picked from commit 5462b33673ea23eb9db16d44035d46d29fa455bb)

openstack%2Ffuel-library~master~I9c3f54f3c0fd2afdcb425d37a3daecfa3c0173af,openstack/fuel-library,master,bug/1342075,I9c3f54f3c0fd2afdcb425d37a3daecfa3c0173af,Cobbler docker mode fixes,MERGED,2014-07-16 09:45:56.000000000,2014-07-24 10:04:09.000000000,2014-07-24 10:04:08.000000000,132,122,0,107284,e91c20221ee687066e058664162430b4131c8f62,27,7,3,2,7195,Matthew Mosesohn,mmosesohn,Cobbler docker mode fixes
Skip cobbler::iptables in docker container for
all docker modes and don't create profiles and
distros during docker build.
IPtables cannot be modified inside a Docker
container. It creates errors that interfere
with deployment.
Change-Id: I9c3f54f3c0fd2afdcb425d37a3daecfa3c0173af
Closes-Bug: #1342075
Related-Bug: #1337288

openstack%2Fdevstack~master~I669e054a8489fe7ac7f5c00df6535349d477e8c4,openstack/devstack,master,bp/neutron-ovs-dvr,I669e054a8489fe7ac7f5c00df6535349d477e8c4,Add DVR support to DevStack,MERGED,2014-06-27 16:02:40.000000000,2014-07-24 09:59:06.000000000,2014-07-24 09:59:06.000000000,28,1,9,103180,eea7621d237228325007f2ba301fb62ba91185e7,107,13,13,2,1131,Brian Haley,brian-haley,Add DVR support to DevStack
This patch introduces a new Neutron  config option: Q_DVR_MODE.
The possible values are:
- legacy  : No DVR functionality
- dvr_snat: Controller/single node DVR
- dvr     : Compute node in multi-node DVR
When DVR is enabled the following configuration changes will be
in place:
- neutron.conf
- router_distributed=True
- l3_agent.ini
- agent_mode=$Q_DVR_MODE
- ovs_neutron_plugin.ini:
- enable_distributed_routing=True
- l2_population=True
- tunnel_types=vxlan
Supports-blueprint: neutron-ovs-dvr
Change-Id: I669e054a8489fe7ac7f5c00df6535349d477e8c4

openstack%2Fheat~master~I81f8ed05e6dc7f14ec093cf2178f3ab5e3e4dda0,openstack/heat,master,stack,I81f8ed05e6dc7f14ec093cf2178f3ab5e3e4dda0,Move the Stack class into stack.py,MERGED,2014-07-16 09:59:19.000000000,2014-07-24 09:54:32.000000000,2014-07-24 09:54:31.000000000,968,947,7,107290,c49f3beee6a1dda2dabecebd67f6a65144931370,77,16,8,2,4715,Angus Salkeld,asalkeld,Move the Stack class into stack.py
Stack is one of the most important classes in our project
and it is in a module with seemingly an unrelated name.
The name is historical, it started off been an assortment of functions
that parsed the template and much of the original content has
been moved out bit by bit into specialized modules leaving the Stack
class behind. This patch will hopefully complete the job by putting
the Stack class into the stack module.
More changes are to come to make sure that the users of the parser module
migrate to using the template and stack modules directly.
Change-Id: I81f8ed05e6dc7f14ec093cf2178f3ab5e3e4dda0

openstack%2Fheat~master~I20d9586201806ac34e303689660ff565cb9f2b5c,openstack/heat,master,,I20d9586201806ac34e303689660ff565cb9f2b5c,Create a new revision of HOT for Juno,MERGED,2014-07-08 19:09:55.000000000,2014-07-24 09:54:24.000000000,2014-07-24 09:54:23.000000000,57,4,15,105558,c26cf90325c7edc3e663785c0fbf1d4211dfa7dd,42,8,3,5,4257,Zane Bitter,zaneb,Create a new revision of HOT for Juno
The next revision of HOT, dated 2014-10-16 to coincide with the Juno
release date, will support the list_join function and remove support for
the CFN-style functions. There may also be other changes throughout the
Juno development cycle.

openstack%2Ffuel-web~master~Ie0ad618122034caf6e4a9433bf76c033e241f369,openstack/fuel-web,master,validate-nsx-settings,Ie0ad618122034caf6e4a9433bf76c033e241f369,validate NSX configuration parameters on Settings tab,MERGED,2014-07-24 08:46:48.000000000,2014-07-24 09:35:54.000000000,2014-07-24 09:35:53.000000000,21,3,0,109213,deb05002fa6591dbd5735bc8beea25e47faffe12,10,5,1,1,11427,Igor Zinovik,izinovik,validate NSX configuration parameters on Settings tab
- right now it is possible to start deploy with empty NSX settings, we
must validate settings before deployment starts
- validate NSX username, must be not empty
- validate NSX password, must be not empty
- validate transport zone and L3 gateway UUIDs
- validate NSX endpoints and URL, must be valid IPv4 and valid
HTTP/HTTPS URL
- while here explicitly specify in comments and warnings that right now
we support only IPv4 addresses
Change-Id: Ie0ad618122034caf6e4a9433bf76c033e241f369
Closes-bug: #1347682

openstack%2Fheat~master~I6b13c1201e46c0e73aa11e78825045b345931fb7,openstack/heat,master,bug/1329453,I6b13c1201e46c0e73aa11e78825045b345931fb7,Refactor OS::Nova::Server delete handling,MERGED,2014-06-12 23:36:10.000000000,2014-07-24 08:38:07.000000000,2014-07-22 13:55:52.000000000,37,8,32,99800,3942548450238d4ac79866bb358a27c9d6a2ef6d,69,13,10,2,7256,Randall Burt,randall-burt,Refactor OS::Nova::Server delete handling
OS::Nova::Server used an internal coroutine to handle_delete instead of
implementing check_delete_complete. While this mostly worked, the coroutine
didn't account for errors in deletion from Nova nor did it use a timeout. This
would lead to infinite execution when servers didn't delete properly. This
patch refactors delete to use the standard handle->check lifecycle methodology
and accounts for error statuses during delete.
Partial-Bug: #1329453

openstack%2Fnova~master~Ifcb2e18211347ccf3e5472779c5917a729a6eced,openstack/nova,master,bug/1308565,Ifcb2e18211347ccf3e5472779c5917a729a6eced,Check for resize path on libvirt instance delete,MERGED,2014-06-11 20:41:36.000000000,2014-07-24 08:16:09.000000000,2014-07-24 08:16:07.000000000,189,49,5,99472,98e6891dfd4408c56644f55fe3cff88703beb4bf,60,10,7,2,8001,John Warren,jswarren,Check for resize path on libvirt instance delete
If an instance is deleted after the instance's disk image path has
been renamed by adding the ""_resize"" suffix to it but before the
resize operation completes, the libvirt driver will not delete the
orphaned files and manual intervention is needed to get them deleted.
This fix addresses the issue by attempting to rename the instance path
by adding a ""_del"" suffix and if that fails, renaming the instance path
with the ""_resize"" suffix by replacing the ""_resize"" suffix with the
_del"" suffix.  If both renaming operations fail, the sequence is
repeated, in case the the disk image path initially had the ""_resize""
suffix and another thread removed it before the second rename operation
was attempted. These rename operations are used in favor of checking
for the existence of paths and deleting if found, because rename
operations are atomic whereas another thread could rename the path
between the exist check and the deleting.
Regardless of the outcome of the renaming operations, the existence of
the instance path with the ""_del"" suffix is verified and if it exists,
it is deleted. This is done in case a prior delete operation that
managed to create the ""_del"" path was subsequently interrupted before
all instance files could be deleted.
Note that the LibvirtConnTestCase.test_delete_instance_files test case
was removed in order to eliminate redundancy.
Closes-Bug: #1308565
Change-Id: Ifcb2e18211347ccf3e5472779c5917a729a6eced

openstack%2Fcinder~master~I58eaa75181fd0b606628584308fd83bdeaa8b64f,openstack/cinder,master,bp/add-export-import-volumes,I58eaa75181fd0b606628584308fd83bdeaa8b64f,Implements new 'bootable' option for manage existing volume.,MERGED,2014-07-21 20:20:03.000000000,2014-07-24 05:18:44.000000000,2014-07-24 05:18:43.000000000,83,74,2,108488,65c10a3329dbf09b0c533a49157242f1a521f691,29,10,3,11,7420,Geraint North,geraintnorth,Implements new 'bootable' option for manage existing volume.
A 'bootable' option (defaults to False) can be passed as part of
the HTTP POST request to manage an existing volume.  This is
passed into the database when the volume is created.
Also changes all drivers to use the more agnostic keys
'source-name' or 'source-id' when specifying
which existing volume to manage.  This change is to support the
cinderclient change in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/76216/
to make it easier for CLI users to manage existing volumes
without having to know the implementation-specifics of the driver.
Change-Id: I58eaa75181fd0b606628584308fd83bdeaa8b64f
Implements: blueprint add-export-import-volumes

openstack%2Fceilometer~master~I29ee910e5beb5669377baaaa2810044a7c40d9ad,openstack/ceilometer,master,bug/1329716,I29ee910e5beb5669377baaaa2810044a7c40d9ad,Add retry function for alarm REST notifier,MERGED,2014-06-13 10:46:19.000000000,2014-07-24 05:15:37.000000000,2014-07-24 05:15:37.000000000,40,13,28,99905,ac1b4f1e8510575e788d6145ed03ec79a0bc83e2,120,15,8,2,8988,Rikimaru Honjo,rikimaru.honjo,Add retry function for alarm REST notifier
The alarm REST notifier does not have retry function: notification simply
fails, for example, when the receiver is down. With this patch, retry
function for alarm REST notifier is added.
In some cases, alarm notifier can not get response even if the receiver is
working fine (e.g. temporarily lost connection, failing over).
Currently, alarm notifier give up to notify in that case.
So, this patch introduces ability to retry to alarm notifier.
By setting a unique request-id in HTTP request header (same id on retry),
the receiver can decide if the notification is new or redundant.
Change-Id: I29ee910e5beb5669377baaaa2810044a7c40d9ad
Closes-bug: #1329716

openstack%2Fcinder~master~I51b084ce38e1aaad4ded63b75b097137dedc088c,openstack/cinder,master,bug/1346911,I51b084ce38e1aaad4ded63b75b097137dedc088c,Fixes Cinder volume upload to image on windows,MERGED,2014-07-23 17:59:32.000000000,2014-07-24 05:14:21.000000000,2014-07-24 05:14:20.000000000,2,2,0,109056,9c1214fdedd1a6ee336f25f7f84079d5918c9ff5,12,8,1,1,12187,Claudiu Nesa,cnesa,Fixes Cinder volume upload to image on windows
Due to fact that when uploading a volume to an image the file is
opened in text mode and the different line endings style on
windows glance client won't be able to upload the desired file.
The solutions is to simply open the file in binary mode when
performing this action.

openstack%2Fpython-keystoneclient~master~I4bfb89d02909176be420dd978f8235d94978c494,openstack/python-keystoneclient,master,bug/1347957,I4bfb89d02909176be420dd978f8235d94978c494,Reorder the old compatibility arguments,MERGED,2014-07-23 22:51:04.000000000,2014-07-24 04:35:54.000000000,2014-07-24 04:35:54.000000000,5,4,0,109141,82e45a6f5cb3e63d60d369d9fe06cb29e0a699e3,9,13,1,1,67,Vish Ishaya,vishvananda,Reorder the old compatibility arguments

openstack%2Frequirements~master~I564e6eb6842cfb0d7f4c29a319071667a695e99a,openstack/requirements,master,bp/greenio-executor,I564e6eb6842cfb0d7f4c29a319071667a695e99a,Add greenio dependency,MERGED,2014-07-22 10:23:55.000000000,2014-07-24 03:56:04.000000000,2014-07-24 03:56:03.000000000,2,1,0,108637,be0997f62015001c2584e3a1401af0bd26ddcf1c,16,6,1,1,9107,Victor Stinner,haypo,Add greenio dependency
The greenio project will be used in OpenStack to support executing
trollius coroutines in greenlet. The first user will be the Oslo
Messaging project: see the ""greenio executor"" spec (accepted for Juno).
Later, at least Ceilometer will be modified to use explicit trollius
coroutines instead of implicit eventlet greenthreads.
greenio 0.6 is the first version supporting trollius, and it requires at
least trollius 1.0.
For your information, I am the maintainer of the trollius project and I
am working with Yury Selivanov on greenio. I am also working directly on
the tulip project and asyncio in Python 3.4 and 3.5.
blueprint greenio-executor
Change-Id: I564e6eb6842cfb0d7f4c29a319071667a695e99a

openstack%2Fnova~master~I867a9b35e5273b96afc443e5c436a15d0c45161b,openstack/nova,master,bp/add-differencing-vhdx-resize-support,I867a9b35e5273b96afc443e5c436a15d0c45161b,Add differencing vhdx resize support in Hyper-V Driver,MERGED,2014-06-26 08:38:33.000000000,2014-07-24 03:50:41.000000000,2014-07-24 03:50:39.000000000,125,44,10,102764,cddb01e2a4249509f11a91b11f44d590e77d4c04,49,12,3,6,8543,Lucian Petrut,plucian,Add differencing vhdx resize support in Hyper-V Driver
Differencing VHDX images can be resized, unlike differencing VHD images.
Even so, the Nova Hyper-V driver currently does not support this.
This feature is required for resizing existing instances which use CoW
VHDX images and also in order to resize the root disk image when
spawning a new instance.
The methods which get the internal maximum size of a vhd/vhdx
image have been updated to lookup the parent disk and get the according
size instead of raising an exception in case of differencing images.
Change-Id: I867a9b35e5273b96afc443e5c436a15d0c45161b
Implements: blueprint add-differencing-vhdx-resize-support

openstack%2Fzaqar~master~I72ae87e1c479b6be6fbc8ce1fbaee89b2729e41a,openstack/zaqar,master,bp/api-v1,I72ae87e1c479b6be6fbc8ce1fbaee89b2729e41a,API v1.1 - Encapsulate message post bodies in a JSON object,MERGED,2014-07-22 18:30:03.000000000,2014-07-24 03:40:55.000000000,2014-07-24 02:21:35.000000000,177,130,6,108795,38c28a2de8da58b1ed0735d76f8d29babb1a9394,15,10,1,23,6427,Kurt Griffiths,kgriffs,API v1.1 - Encapsulate message post bodies in a JSON object

openstack%2Fneutron~master~I16e619d4d0783fa3fa6122f005fbd246b7b8a3d6,openstack/neutron,master,bug/1346902,I16e619d4d0783fa3fa6122f005fbd246b7b8a3d6,Fix error when update a router created before dvr,ABANDONED,2014-07-22 13:29:03.000000000,2014-07-24 03:03:49.000000000,,5,1,0,108692,7065b49f432dad8fb14d6a0350e30332f6579a7e,19,16,1,1,7170,Zang MingJie,zealot,Fix error when update a router created before dvr

openstack%2Fcinder~master~I62cd992e7150e7d16f1a2b2be6ef61c64b638858,openstack/cinder,master,bug/1274123,I62cd992e7150e7d16f1a2b2be6ef61c64b638858,Storwize/SVC: Fix races in host-related functions,MERGED,2014-02-08 21:07:11.000000000,2014-07-24 02:56:51.000000000,2014-02-11 13:11:57.000000000,5,1,0,72113,5ba26c8aa5b295a1202fbc6c01eb050ce3f3af3d,18,9,2,1,4355,Avishay Traeger,avishay-il,Storwize/SVC: Fix races in host-related functions
In the Storwize/SVC driver, initialize_connection checks if a host
object exists on the storage, and if not, creates one. Similarly,
terminate_connection checks if there are any more mappings for this
host, and deletes the host object if there are none. Consequently, there
exist races between two initialize_connection calls, two
terminate_connection calls, or one and one.
The easy solution here is to use locks. Because locks are files on the
local machine, this implies that all cinder-volume processes managing a
given Storwize/SVC contoller run on the same machine.
Change-Id: I62cd992e7150e7d16f1a2b2be6ef61c64b638858
Closes-Bug: #1274123

openstack%2Fneutron~master~I7a09d34f3a9dee0a43b76c5d781ee9eb9938953a,openstack/neutron,master,bug/1336596,I7a09d34f3a9dee0a43b76c5d781ee9eb9938953a,Clear entries in Cisco N1KV specific tables on rollback,MERGED,2014-07-15 18:33:52.000000000,2014-07-24 01:36:26.000000000,2014-07-24 01:36:25.000000000,151,33,8,107145,73b4239fbef5e52494cf3ffc3293dbb79b52d91c,60,31,3,4,7018,Abhishek Raut,abhiraut,Clear entries in Cisco N1KV specific tables on rollback

database but leaves a few stale entries in the n1kv specific tables.
This change addresses the proper clean up of tables. i.e. VLAN/VXLAN

Closes-bug: #1336596

openstack%2Fneutron~master~Ibdcd74f47043762386b62f3ec0fa1723060446ac,openstack/neutron,master,bug/1316618,Ibdcd74f47043762386b62f3ec0fa1723060446ac,call security_groups_member_updated in port_update,MERGED,2014-06-19 19:10:57.000000000,2014-07-24 01:20:28.000000000,2014-07-24 01:20:27.000000000,82,1,5,101293,e97eea83ae162b9ce0f45f1ff334dbf70608fe3f,75,24,4,2,2531,Xu Chen,xchenum,call security_groups_member_updated in port_update
When a running VM is added to a security group, all existing VMs (ports)
in the security group should be notified/updated - otherwise they would
have incorrect rules, not knowing the new VM/port added.
The current behavior would only update the port of the added VM. This
patch forces an security_groups_member_updated() call for all the
security groups that have ports removed or added.
Change-Id: Ibdcd74f47043762386b62f3ec0fa1723060446ac
Closes-Bug: 1316618

openstack%2Fheat~master~If67e2d6761003558b32909c4655fadb4d0630b86,openstack/heat,master,bp/client-plugins,If67e2d6761003558b32909c4655fadb4d0630b86,Store clients in context,MERGED,2014-07-21 17:00:35.000000000,2014-07-24 00:09:36.000000000,2014-07-24 00:09:36.000000000,159,127,1,108436,1619c42beac1ec76328cea564f9be23ecac25219,20,16,1,22,4571,Steve Baker,steve-stevebaker,Store clients in context
Having the Stack create the Clients object means that custom constraints
do not have access to the already created clients. This greatly
complicates test mocking, and results in unnecessarily created
constraint-scoped clients.
This change makes the Clients be created in RequestContext on demand.
Constraints use the Clients associated with the context.
Mocking client create calls is simplified, generally needing to
call _create once instead of MultipleTimes()

openstack%2Foslo.messaging~stable%2Ficehouse~I92e7c01dd87d634b741bbcaea92f48730fdd555e,openstack/oslo.messaging,stable/icehouse,,I92e7c01dd87d634b741bbcaea92f48730fdd555e,Ensures listener queues exist in fake driver,MERGED,2014-07-18 06:40:17.000000000,2014-07-23 22:59:25.000000000,2014-07-23 22:59:24.000000000,13,0,0,107911,d822f6cbf0f41481fb934d8def228a1029eb7b44,29,7,2,1,1247,Mark McLoughlin,markmc,Ensures listener queues exist in fake driver
The fanout queues of the fake driver are created at the first executor
poll, but if we use eventlet executor and the fake driver, when the sender
delivers a fanout message before the first poll, the message goes to the
topic queue instead of the server fanout queue.
The changes fixes that by ensuring the all queues exists when the
listener is created.
Closes bug #1331453
Related-Bug: #1334798
Co-authored-by: Paul Michali <pcm@cisco.com>
Change-Id: I92e7c01dd87d634b741bbcaea92f48730fdd555e
(cherry picked from commit e582da68f4c5edd3e4a3cdb62819c210c72dcfad)
(cherry picked from commit 0cfafac2468afe6b601a985495382aae3351b217)

openstack%2Ffuel-main~master~Ic3011e7268f9d7d989a29295a126b247ddc6df2c,openstack/fuel-main,master,fix_tempest,Ic3011e7268f9d7d989a29295a126b247ddc6df2c,Set path to config file in tempest,MERGED,2014-07-22 10:12:04.000000000,2014-07-23 20:19:23.000000000,2014-07-23 20:19:21.000000000,3,0,0,108633,b6596e295b2df79e265a60396c64fffcf99070ff,27,4,4,1,9545,Andrey Kurilin,akurilin,Set path to config file in tempest

openstack%2Fironic~master~Ie5ff082c4656e81c268f93cd51d75799087fe0c9,openstack/ironic,master,90436,Ie5ff082c4656e81c268f93cd51d75799087fe0c9,Don't update neutron VIF if MAC is duplicated,ABANDONED,2014-04-25 18:11:21.000000000,2014-07-23 20:18:03.000000000,,54,13,4,90436,f4589ed14c2a10e7b08282c2af35ad87ba89823e,22,5,3,2,2889,Aeva Black,tenbrae,Don't update neutron VIF if MAC is duplicated
Conductor Manager update_port() can be used to change the MAC address of
a Port. If the requested address already exists, a MACAlreadyExists
exception is raised and returned to the client. This patch changes two
aspects of that method:
* If a MACAlreadyExists exception is raised, it does not need to be
logged by the conductor. This patch adds it to the list of expected
exceptions to pass back over RPC.
* If the MAC is associated to a VIF in neutron, do not update that VIF
if the new MAC duplicates another MAC already known to Ironic.
Change-Id: Ie5ff082c4656e81c268f93cd51d75799087fe0c9

openstack%2Fnova~master~I662dfa4f81e24cb2553ffa2578f4c8530eee9fd3,openstack/nova,master,bug/1322195,I662dfa4f81e24cb2553ffa2578f4c8530eee9fd3,Store volume backed snapshot in current tenant.,MERGED,2014-05-22 16:02:41.000000000,2014-07-23 19:46:57.000000000,2014-07-23 19:46:54.000000000,2,1,2,94917,a55f41492e5ce9bbc2f2ef3435a7e7e65bf6cb3e,72,16,2,2,10224,Feodor Tersin,ftersin,Store volume backed snapshot in current tenant.
Fix owner of a creating volume backed snapshot.
Snapshot of an instance booted on a volume based on another tenant's
public image is created in the wrong tenant when invoked by admin.
Snapshot metadata (including owner) is based on image metadata. But
when the snapshot is being created by admin, Glance doesn't change
it's owner if it's set. So we forcibly remove owner (tenant)
attribute from image metadata.
Change-Id: I662dfa4f81e24cb2553ffa2578f4c8530eee9fd3
Closes-Bug: #1322195

openstack%2Frequirements~stable%2Fhavana~I951951ce24388cc1c7a9e472daf58a1e12124aba,openstack/requirements,stable/havana,bug/1346827,I951951ce24388cc1c7a9e472daf58a1e12124aba,Really ensure that sphinx <1.2 is installed,MERGED,2014-07-23 14:26:22.000000000,2014-07-23 19:46:50.000000000,2014-07-23 19:46:50.000000000,1,1,0,109005,77587b73cd505eac47d0f72857fca6f160e20dba,9,5,1,1,9656,Ihar Hrachyshka,ihrachys,Really ensure that sphinx <1.2 is installed
Because sphinx have release on pypi version suffixed by a letter for beta
purpose, ie: 1.2b3, even <1.2 is in requirement.txt 1.2b3 is installed.
This changes force the upper version to 1.1.999, to not install beta version
of sphinx 1.2.
Conflicts:
Change-Id: I951951ce24388cc1c7a9e472daf58a1e12124aba
Closes-bug: #1346827

openstack%2Foslo.db~master~I3b0edaba0604fa9885c145719287f236d7ba3fda,openstack/oslo.db,master,,I3b0edaba0604fa9885c145719287f236d7ba3fda,Removed use of BaseException.message from oslo.db,ABANDONED,2014-05-30 15:59:43.000000000,2014-07-23 19:24:03.000000000,,12,12,0,96813,3d501cd691441ad1f4430feeb0487051ddbf9781,10,5,1,1,8411,Andrew Lazarev,alazarev,Removed use of BaseException.message from oslo.db
The usage of the .message attribute has been deprecated since Python 2.6.
However, the exceptions raised by SQLAlchemy can differ when using
unicode() and accessing .message. Using args[0] as a message is the best
we can do until SQLAlchemy is fully Python 3 compliant. SQLAlchemy itself
uses args[0] as a message internally.
Change-Id: I3b0edaba0604fa9885c145719287f236d7ba3fda
Closes-Bug: #1280435

openstack%2Fneutron~stable%2Ficehouse~Ib61756e3bd5866318cbc3bb9856344571399d656,openstack/neutron,stable/icehouse,,Ib61756e3bd5866318cbc3bb9856344571399d656,NSX: fix router ports port_security_enabled=False,MERGED,2014-07-21 23:59:11.000000000,2014-07-23 18:02:31.000000000,2014-07-22 05:42:44.000000000,4,2,0,108534,b65c036c3322706533b91d955f741f18687c44d1,18,13,1,2,4395,Aaron Rosen,arosen,NSX: fix router ports port_security_enabled=False
Previously there was a bug that resulted in a security group being
added to router ports which was not supported in NSX. Removing the
security group didn't actually completely solve the problem as we
never cleared the allowed_address_pairs on the router port. This
patch fixes this issue by disabling port_security_enabled on the
router port.
Closes-bug: 1344266
Related-bug: 1329043
(cherry picked from commit 25f1439ff356f78ab0d28a74dfc75d50e2f030b6)

openstack%2Fnova~master~I64108338e3c958ba1276aaf113a68861cbe286f5,openstack/nova,master,bp/extensible-resource-tracking,I64108338e3c958ba1276aaf113a68861cbe286f5,Add extensible resources to resource tracker,MERGED,2014-02-06 15:22:43.000000000,2014-07-23 17:43:10.000000000,2014-07-23 13:03:34.000000000,762,84,197,71557,50b4ba4ee583d25eef10a6608172c002f9bec6f2,346,25,33,12,7461,Paul Murray,ptm,Add extensible resources to resource tracker
A resource plugin extension point is added to the resource
tracker to allow the types of resources allocated at the compute
node to be extensible. Information maintained by these plug-ins
is written to the compute_nodes table in the database. The
scheduler uses the information in the compute_nodes table to
determine scheduling decisions.
A plugin that implements vcpu resource tracking is included
and all other code for tracking vcpu has been removed. This
example ensures the plugins are tested in gate jobs.
Co-Authored-By: Andrea Rosa  <andrea.rosa@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Paul Murray  <pmurray@hp.com>
This is part of: blueprint extensible-resource-tracking
Change-Id: I64108338e3c958ba1276aaf113a68861cbe286f5

openstack%2Ftripleo-ci~master~I1181c55fc9013f942ba9464239954d8e9ad6996d,openstack/tripleo-ci,master,rm-revert,I1181c55fc9013f942ba9464239954d8e9ad6996d,Revert ""Revert heat : Store clients in context""",MERGED,2014-07-21 17:10:09.000000000,2014-07-23 17:23:03.000000000,2014-07-23 17:23:03.000000000,2,2,0,108438,5acee734c559385c66cc6d9a354f7b2d8ae0dd6a,11,3,1,1,1926,Derek Higgins,derekh,"Revert ""Revert heat : Store clients in context""

openstack%2Fheat~master~Ie59f0903b7aba1e40737bece049dd4b0c6cda233,openstack/heat,master,,Ie59f0903b7aba1e40737bece049dd4b0c6cda233,Move server task start delete into check_delete_complete,ABANDONED,2014-07-23 15:57:02.000000000,2014-07-23 17:14:30.000000000,,13,5,5,109027,b27d5a920d743ea479f17fd9f0480748415fa5b2,6,3,1,1,4328,Steven Hardy,shardy,Move server task start delete into check_delete_complete
Starting the task in handle_delete has the undesirable side-effect of
serializing the delete calls to nova, which results in a noticeable
serialization of the resource deletes for non-dependent resources.
Moving the start to check_delete_complete solves the problem, then the
resources all transition into DELETE_IN_PROGRESS at approximately the
same time, and it can be observed that the underlying nova servers are
set into deleting state in parallel.
Change-Id: Ie59f0903b7aba1e40737bece049dd4b0c6cda233
Partial-Bug: #1347775

openstack%2Fheat~master~Ie78dcde79518ac8598641c26366992e4ea4241f6,openstack/heat,master,bug/1224828,Ie78dcde79518ac8598641c26366992e4ea4241f6,Add RPC call to retrieve the parameters for a stack,ABANDONED,2014-07-16 22:48:05.000000000,2014-07-23 17:14:18.000000000,,27,0,1,107524,8183e8e8982ebff0b38939043bb7631449777aa1,8,6,1,3,9591,Ton Ngo,tango,Add RPC call to retrieve the parameters for a stack
Given a stack id, load the stack from the DB and return the
parameters and registry currently used.  These are from the
last stack-create or stack-update command and were combined
from the --parameters CLI and the environment file.
Partially-implements: blueprint troubleshooting-low-level-control
Closes-Bug: 1224828
Change-Id: Ie78dcde79518ac8598641c26366992e4ea4241f6

openstack%2Fneutron~master~I1cf1441a179ec527674276b71e9924841f8570b6,openstack/neutron,master,bp/provider-network-partial-specs,I1cf1441a179ec527674276b71e9924841f8570b6,Add partial specs support in ML2 for multiprovider extension,MERGED,2014-06-20 10:03:34.000000000,2014-07-23 15:24:59.000000000,2014-07-22 10:19:54.000000000,73,19,22,101467,926d8a939ab97d0eb41b04d495f865a64da11b43,169,29,7,10,8124,cbrandily,cbrandily,Add partial specs support in ML2 for multiprovider extension
ML2 provider network partial specs let admins choose some
multiprovider network attributes and let neutron choose remaining
attributes. This change provides the implementation for
multiprovider networks.
In practice, for VLAN/GRE/VXLAN segments provider:segmentation_id
choice can be delegated to neutron, in such case neutron try to find
a segment in tenant network pools which respects provided segment
attributes. For VLAN segments provider:physical_network choice can
also be delegated.
DocImpact
Implements blueprint provider-network-partial-specs

openstack%2Fpython-keystoneclient~master~I435a118bb31338a37a29eec68b8e9ce50d163675,openstack/python-keystoneclient,master,methd_token_url,I435a118bb31338a37a29eec68b8e9ce50d163675,Rename saml2_token_url to token_url,MERGED,2014-07-23 10:23:29.000000000,2014-07-23 15:06:33.000000000,2014-07-23 15:06:32.000000000,3,3,0,108946,14716ed1f2b03aa9e49ab51a87b1a7ecf99abdb3,8,5,1,1,8978,Marek Denis,marek-denis,Rename saml2_token_url to token_url

The original workaround was for an init script that grabbed stdout.
This was some time ago and I think it's safe to remove.
It can be a problem on Fedora; out-of-the-box some old F20 images can
have a broken dependency when rabbitmq installs.  With this in place,
all helpful output goes into the temp log file, but it is never shown
because the install_packages function exits the script.  Thus things
just stop and you have no idea why.
Change-Id: I2f5b934492a8c9d7b93e89fdcfa776bf15f25cb8

openstack%2Frequirements~stable%2Ficehouse~I951951ce24388cc1c7a9e472daf58a1e12124aba,openstack/requirements,stable/icehouse,,I951951ce24388cc1c7a9e472daf58a1e12124aba,Really ensure that sphinx <1.2 is installed,MERGED,2014-07-22 09:46:59.000000000,2014-07-23 14:36:39.000000000,2014-07-22 16:36:41.000000000,1,1,0,108624,d79fb647a9800214caaa8679cf4030aa500c9f7a,13,5,2,1,2813,Mehdi Abaakouk,sileht,Really ensure that sphinx <1.2 is installed

openstack%2Fgnocchi~master~I346ba5b316049ba622c8f6e633cf9aaea1c0519c,openstack/gnocchi,master,jd/new-aggreg,I346ba5b316049ba622c8f6e633cf9aaea1c0519c,carbonara: change time serie aggregation implementation,MERGED,2014-07-07 14:16:17.000000000,2014-07-23 14:11:21.000000000,2014-07-23 14:11:21.000000000,518,208,11,105185,57d730fd7e206f88c98b617e1d78a16eb1478b64,54,7,12,5,1669,Julien Danjou,jdanjou,carbonara: change time serie aggregation implementation

openstack%2Fceilometer~master~Ibec7ef8ca763e577235077a086f002f9683d5296,openstack/ceilometer,master,swift-ceilometer-logging,Ibec7ef8ca763e577235077a086f002f9683d5296,Hardcode the logging level in swift_middleware,ABANDONED,2014-03-24 15:31:55.000000000,2014-07-23 14:00:33.000000000,,6,1,0,82526,cbc397e0458f42fee4e7a29c547332b974f0c825,15,5,1,1,7478,Nadya Shakhat,nprivalova,Hardcode the logging level in swift_middleware
Now Swift writes it's proxy-server-logs into syslog as well as swift-proxy.log.
This behaviour is to be changed after adding oslo.logging into Swift.
From the other hand, we use pipeline.setup_pipeline inside Swift. And all swift-logging configs
become applied to Ceilometer's pipeline. As a result (in case of DEBUG is on) we see too many
Ceilometr-related messages in syslog.
This fix partially closes the bug below.
Closes bug 1294789
Change-Id: Ibec7ef8ca763e577235077a086f002f9683d5296

openstack%2Ftripleo-incubator~master~I533336d193ee7bc46a7be79ff689f447aaf5770a,openstack/tripleo-incubator,master,bp/targeted-node-deployment,I533336d193ee7bc46a7be79ff689f447aaf5770a,Allow capabilities to be set on ironic nodes,ABANDONED,2014-07-16 10:32:22.000000000,2014-07-23 13:51:49.000000000,,18,2,5,107308,2e701aa108f169d875cd261b87e659502ad61f42,37,6,6,1,9420,Matthew Gilliard,gilliard,Allow capabilities to be set on ironic nodes
Since Ide39f4a2796b169025bf0083e021166ae35f30f8, Ironic has been able to
pass nodes' capabilities to the nova scheduler to allow for more
flexible and precise scheduling of instances.  This patch allows devtest
to pass capabilities from nodes.json (if they are present) to the
'ironic node-update' command which is already used to set nodes'
cpu_arch, memory and disk.
Part of bp targeted-node-deployment
Change-Id: I533336d193ee7bc46a7be79ff689f447aaf5770a

openstack%2Fironic~master~I5994e990deb26841633ca26de1a5fb63b743271a,openstack/ironic,master,bug/1261915,I5994e990deb26841633ca26de1a5fb63b743271a,Add drivers.base.BaseDriver.get_properties(),MERGED,2014-07-15 15:45:45.000000000,2014-07-23 13:31:40.000000000,2014-07-23 13:31:38.000000000,294,32,17,107092,c75a070520b02deafe61343157d3a4219374f6d3,71,10,8,18,6618,Ruby Loo,rloo,Add drivers.base.BaseDriver.get_properties()

openstack%2Ffuel-library~master~Idd1566dd507878b2f01c2d0ff9956dedc77a4461,openstack/fuel-library,master,f107288,Idd1566dd507878b2f01c2d0ff9956dedc77a4461,Set glance control_exchange to 'glance',MERGED,2014-07-21 18:31:33.000000000,2014-07-23 13:17:25.000000000,2014-07-23 13:17:24.000000000,2,0,1,108463,b483189c848351ab277d20f208e6c97a986a98ea,57,6,7,1,6926,Bogdan Dobrelya,bogdando,Set glance control_exchange to 'glance'
Glance control_exchange in glance-api.conf wasn't set
and glance used default value for this - 'openstack'.
So, exchange 'glance' and queue 'glance' didn't exist in rabbit.
But ceilometer as default glance control exchange uses 'glance'.
This patch fixes the fix for this problem and change-id as well
Closes-bug: #1335891
Change-Id: Idd1566dd507878b2f01c2d0ff9956dedc77a4461
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Idd1566dd507878b2f01c2d0ff9956dedc77a4461
Related-bug: #1335891

openstack%2Fgnocchi~master~I7f0db8050c0cef5eceec24977e4cb02d4843824d,openstack/gnocchi,master,,I7f0db8050c0cef5eceec24977e4cb02d4843824d,Fix for unneccessary resampling of single-value timeseries,ABANDONED,2014-07-18 14:10:46.000000000,2014-07-23 13:14:47.000000000,,25,1,0,108023,4df82e50aa9a6140845659d7d3ee7e26cca22ef7,7,3,1,2,2284,Eoghan Glynn,eglynn,Fix for unneccessary resampling of single-value timeseries
Resampling a timeseries with one element is unnecessary,
and causes problems in the case of an aggregated timeseries
with aggregation method set to stddev, as the single already-
aggregated value is then discarded due to standard deviation
being undefined for a single datapoint.
The new test fails with the original unselective resampling.
Change-Id: I7f0db8050c0cef5eceec24977e4cb02d4843824d

openstack%2Fhorizon~master~I31c7d70f49f82b6a7fe663fe043ec279ad3c8119,openstack/horizon,master,bug/1323811,I31c7d70f49f82b6a7fe663fe043ec279ad3c8119,Validate available services regions,ABANDONED,2014-07-10 01:43:21.000000000,2014-07-23 13:13:18.000000000,,250,5,5,105933,74a0ea710adf13891e58fd0fe4cd041f001e0854,19,5,2,6,9647,Justin Pomeroy,jpomero,Validate available services regions
This introduces middleware that is used to validate the
available services regions. It makes sure that the initial
region has a compute service and is reachable. If a region
does not provide a compute service endpoint it will be
removed from the list of available regions. If there are no
regions with a compute service endpoint or none of them can be
reached then the user will be redirected to the login page with
a message.
Closes-Bug: 1323811
Change-Id: I31c7d70f49f82b6a7fe663fe043ec279ad3c8119

openstack%2Fironic~master~I60b099beea1bc3a954a5ab4699e623aaa71ba6c5,openstack/ironic,master,bp/add-nodelocked-retry,I60b099beea1bc3a954a5ab4699e623aaa71ba6c5,Implement retry on NodeLocked exceptions,MERGED,2014-07-17 13:56:09.000000000,2014-07-23 13:03:49.000000000,2014-07-23 13:03:48.000000000,51,2,12,107710,428c24767575419d5b472b52f2b622588a3a7253,36,5,4,5,3099,David Shrewsbury,dshrews,Implement retry on NodeLocked exceptions
This adds the capability to retry node locking when a node is already
locked. Two conductor configuration variables are added to control this
behavior, which can be totally disabled by setting the value for the
node_locked_retry_attempts variable to zero.
A new unit test is added to check that the retry will work after first
getting a NodeLocked exception, then succeeding getting the lock on the
next lock attempt.
Change-Id: I60b099beea1bc3a954a5ab4699e623aaa71ba6c5
Blueprint: add-nodelocked-retry

openstack%2Ftempest~master~I261f4ba08083cb7ed60c0a5bdd48a4dc16f4c23d,openstack/tempest,master,fix-verify,I261f4ba08083cb7ed60c0a5bdd48a4dc16f4c23d,Fix a few bugs when running with -u,MERGED,2014-05-02 20:49:47.000000000,2014-07-23 13:03:25.000000000,2014-07-23 13:03:23.000000000,20,18,3,91899,f20ac32b0a9858d7c791ba5d1dfc941d1e58e804,61,10,3,1,1192,David Kranz,david-kranz,Fix a few bugs when running with -u
The default conf file locator needed to reference the file another level up.
The config file set/write did not work if more than one option was changed.
I'm not sure why but think it would be better to just read once, set the
options, and write at the end anyway.
If we are updating and a service is there but not mentioned in the conf file,
we change the conf to True so should also add the service to the available
services.
Change-Id: I261f4ba08083cb7ed60c0a5bdd48a4dc16f4c23d

openstack%2Fdevstack~master~I4e44bec6574e6a4fcfc252418bc267191aef28fb,openstack/devstack,master,bug/1347178,I4e44bec6574e6a4fcfc252418bc267191aef28fb,Fix install_ceilometer and install_ceilometerclient,MERGED,2014-07-22 21:31:00.000000000,2014-07-23 13:03:20.000000000,2014-07-23 13:03:19.000000000,4,9,0,108848,13344bd975b01cbfce6017f91e14964cf03a47be,12,6,1,2,1849,Joe Gordon,jogo,Fix install_ceilometer and install_ceilometerclient
Other projects do a setup_develop in install_*. This standard is used by
grenade to do installations. Currently grenade uses install ceilometer
as part of the upgrade script, but this doesn't actually install the new
ceilometer.
Change-Id: I4e44bec6574e6a4fcfc252418bc267191aef28fb
Closes-Bug: #1347178

openstack%2Ftempest~master~Ie0817e20cb7bacdf33b16fb222a7ee9c91109fc8,openstack/tempest,master,read-template-values,Ie0817e20cb7bacdf33b16fb222a7ee9c91109fc8,Read template's expected value orchest test Part-1,MERGED,2014-06-09 02:13:59.000000000,2014-07-23 13:03:11.000000000,2014-07-23 13:03:11.000000000,41,30,4,98676,961ea1adb882a187fbc2878a092974253481becb,52,11,4,7,8556,Ghanshyam,ghanshyam,Read template's expected value orchest test Part-1
In tests under /tempest/api/orchestration/, resources gets
created based on parameters defined in template (yaml, json).
But while verification of output, expected values are hard coded
in tests. Expected values should be read from template only.
This patch adds the helper to load the values from template
(yaml, json) and apply the changes in
tempest/api/orchestration/test_volumes.py
This patch also rename the existing load_template() function
as it read the template and newly added function load the template
This rename the load_template() to read_template in
tempest/api/orchestration/base.py and corresponding calling files.
Partial-Bug: #1327919
Change-Id: Ie0817e20cb7bacdf33b16fb222a7ee9c91109fc8

openstack%2Fhorizon~master~Ic72ebea0db226faf98c5e04d00d76dedd1fb01c1,openstack/horizon,master,bug/1278920,Ic72ebea0db226faf98c5e04d00d76dedd1fb01c1,Fixes bad performance when editing project members,MERGED,2014-05-06 17:06:18.000000000,2014-07-23 13:03:08.000000000,2014-07-23 13:03:07.000000000,170,50,8,92412,ed43be0a0f40c4b065472da27e6ef6e59a6789ca,83,15,6,4,11022,Rodrigo Duarte Sousa,rodrigods,Fixes bad performance when editing project members
The bug is caused by consecutive client calls when
fetching users' roles in a project.
The fix was to use the /v3/role_assignments endpoint.
Which retrieves all roles in a single client call
(dashboards/admin/projects/workflows.py:
UpdateProjectGroupsAction and UpdateProjectUsersAction).
The compatibility to the previous keystoneclient version
is maintained.
In a scenario with 1000 users with a role in a project
(using devstack), the time to render the Modify Users
page dropped from 45s to 2.5s
Change-Id: Ic72ebea0db226faf98c5e04d00d76dedd1fb01c1
Closes-bug: #1278920

openstack%2Fhorizon~master~I990962483197f54ee9436278463c4709b909297a,openstack/horizon,master,bug/1347036,I990962483197f54ee9436278463c4709b909297a,Fixing data processing image registry,MERGED,2014-07-22 19:11:10.000000000,2014-07-23 13:03:05.000000000,2014-07-23 13:03:04.000000000,2,1,0,108812,bb60aabcba85281e5763b4304337215b5cc5a32a,21,4,1,1,8090,Chad Roberts,croberts,Fixing data processing image registry
The Data Processing Image Registry was not adapted to use
expect the ""previous"" return value from glance.image_list_detailed.
This change allows the Image Registry to work correctly again.
Closes-Bug:  #1347036

openstack%2Ftempest~master~If6026611f3938be0716ce95491a8ee60a53e8c12,openstack/tempest,master,bp/unit-tests,If6026611f3938be0716ce95491a8ee60a53e8c12,Revert ""Add tests for wait_for_server_status""",MERGED,2014-07-22 18:39:14.000000000,2014-07-23 13:02:52.000000000,2014-07-23 13:02:51.000000000,0,219,0,108800,a6b0a2f1290a8c9343869558f1fe7ed860f76899,16,6,1,1,5196,Matthew Treinish,treinish,"Revert ""Add tests for wait_for_server_status""

added a dependency on having a valid tempest config file. At this point instead
of trying to fix all of these issues I'm pushing a revert in the short term and

openstack%2Fpython-keystoneclient~master~I7ee0931d4ea78cf9f463b2f0b54457226c5bea8d,openstack/python-keystoneclient,master,adapter,I7ee0931d4ea78cf9f463b2f0b54457226c5bea8d,Allow passing kwargs from managers to session,MERGED,2014-07-14 00:06:37.000000000,2014-07-23 12:19:52.000000000,2014-07-23 12:19:52.000000000,27,19,0,106658,a58bb4b27ada086f850ee990da9ed0ef15f3294c,23,5,5,1,7191,Jamie Lennox,jamielennox,Allow passing kwargs from managers to session
Resource managers may need to pass certain overrides down to the session
layer. The most common example would be to allow them to specify a
different interface to issue a request to than is common. It is possible
later that we may wish to expose this ability to users as well so that
they can choose in there own programs what interface, endpoint name etc
a particular request should be issued to.

openstack%2Fpuppet-neutron~master~Idbb2fe9ce63985e4236e41a642ef1b783bec3753,openstack/puppet-neutron,master,bug/1343009,Idbb2fe9ce63985e4236e41a642ef1b783bec3753,Make Nova_admin_tenant_id_setter notify neutron-server.,MERGED,2014-07-16 23:37:08.000000000,2014-07-23 11:41:25.000000000,2014-07-23 11:41:24.000000000,1,0,0,107529,c40f3008d51a4d45716240f93dbd7b325797d042,10,4,1,1,8797,Andrew Woodward,xarses,Make Nova_admin_tenant_id_setter notify neutron-server.
Add notification to ensure that changes in Nova_admin_tenant_id_setter
will result with neutron-server restarting. This is necessary, otherwise
it is possible for neutron.conf DEFAULT/nova_admin_tenant_id to not be set
which will result in odd looking auth failures and cause instances to fail
booting

openstack%2Fmurano-dashboard~master~I12e7ad00af3bac35138cc0f8c7d595a08e8eda03,openstack/murano-dashboard,master,bug/1335800,I12e7ad00af3bac35138cc0f8c7d595a08e8eda03,Enhance versionutils.deprecated to work with classes,MERGED,2014-06-30 09:57:03.000000000,2014-07-23 11:19:56.000000000,2014-07-23 11:19:56.000000000,57,5,0,103502,f72d7ea1a02b7da838d003b0092c18bffce96e90,87,10,6,3,8040,Timur Sufiev,tsufiev,Enhance versionutils.deprecated to work with classes

deprecation milestones.

openstack%2Fpuppet-neutron~master~Iee2211db8add4dfafba70706d69d1092339c6206,openstack/puppet-neutron,master,bug/1340999,Iee2211db8add4dfafba70706d69d1092339c6206,agent/lbaas: fix HAproxy package relationship,MERGED,2014-07-14 18:49:07.000000000,2014-07-23 08:58:48.000000000,2014-07-23 08:58:48.000000000,1,2,1,106839,8d488fb2961615c0d3974390a485295d2e4216cf,16,5,3,1,3153,Emilien Macchi,emilienm,agent/lbaas: fix HAproxy package relationship
This patch fix this case:
- manage_haproxy_package is set to false
- puppetlabs-haproxy is not running
- we still want Neutron LBaaS working on the node
- we don't want at all the package managed by Puppet
Only set the dependency if the package is defined in the catalog.
Closes-bug #1340999
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
Change-Id: Iee2211db8add4dfafba70706d69d1092339c6206

openstack%2Fnova~master~I4eee2cbd3d58a98021625aab2d711490e99fc810,openstack/nova,master,bug/1252654,I4eee2cbd3d58a98021625aab2d711490e99fc810,libvirt: Do not take into account VMs with id 0,ABANDONED,2014-03-26 16:10:51.000000000,2014-07-23 08:41:17.000000000,,45,16,9,83114,b79d1b348bb85e1de98f64085a75c7441f47c571,156,17,16,2,91,Alvaro,aloga,libvirt: Do not take into account VMs with id 0
Nova was issuing warnings in the logs about the discrepancy between the
number of VMs in a compute node and the number of instances in the DB.
This is caused because libvirt returns the total count of domains in a
node, taking into account the Domain-0 (i.e. the hypervisor).
Change-Id: I4eee2cbd3d58a98021625aab2d711490e99fc810
Closes-bug: 1252654
Closes-bug: 1280315

openstack%2Ftaskflow~master~I33a970284317aed70bba7ae0256a613bfa79b1df,openstack/taskflow,master,bp/exception-traceability,I33a970284317aed70bba7ae0256a613bfa79b1df,Track execution cause nodes and triggered nodes,ABANDONED,2014-06-02 23:30:16.000000000,2014-07-23 08:19:01.000000000,,59,3,0,97367,3ad0f81d8b657aaff77c2e3449aad1e114c1f64e,6,3,1,3,1297,Joshua Harlow,harlowja,Track execution cause nodes and triggered nodes
In order to be able to provide how an atom was triggered and
to provide what path of causes were when a atom fails we need
to retain enough of this information ourselves internally while
running and expose that information via a simple runtime/engine
only interface.
Part of: blueprint exception-traceability
Change-Id: I33a970284317aed70bba7ae0256a613bfa79b1df

openstack%2Ftaskflow~master~I85035d12b154724ad76ac68a30b318ca0b623614,openstack/taskflow,master,,I85035d12b154724ad76ac68a30b318ca0b623614,Differentiate returned failures and actual failures,ABANDONED,2014-06-18 01:24:11.000000000,2014-07-23 08:16:54.000000000,,59,48,0,100740,bd511c94b413c913d6f0d4c8b45419d45ce3d72b,11,3,3,12,1297,Joshua Harlow,harlowja,Differentiate returned failures and actual failures
There is a difference between a task or retry atom
returning a failure object (which we do not prevent)
and a task or retry atom raising an exception that
we capture in a failure object.

openstack%2Fnova~master~Idc989b407639b7ff441208b2138c103e8737f6a7,openstack/nova,master,bp/scheduler-lib,Idc989b407639b7ff441208b2138c103e8737f6a7,POC - Scheduler client for ResourceTracker,ABANDONED,2014-07-09 14:14:42.000000000,2014-07-23 07:23:39.000000000,,177,54,0,105747,6fa638eedb36c401aa67f11a329f0411b2767123,15,12,2,4,7166,Sylvain Bauza,sbauza,POC - Scheduler client for ResourceTracker
This is a POC for seeing the level of changes necessary for moving
the ResourceTracker in Scheduler with an interface.
The main issue is how the RT is accessing Driver methods, as it
needs to backport all driver calls to the computeManager and pass
the values in the parameters.
There are still some open questions, see the changes with the FIXME
and NOTE comments.
Implements blueprint scheduler-lib

openstack%2Fnova~master~Idf9c179b2dd439462a646568ffd5098cd5d7851f,openstack/nova,master,bug/1296414-2,Idf9c179b2dd439462a646568ffd5098cd5d7851f,Change the comments of SOFT_DELETED race condition,MERGED,2014-05-13 05:26:19.000000000,2014-07-23 05:08:50.000000000,2014-07-23 05:08:48.000000000,6,5,2,93374,1b35a3b263f47558e2e7791e27810741881eea43,76,14,5,1,6062,jichenjc,jichenjc,Change the comments of SOFT_DELETED race condition
_reclaim_queued_deletes will only find instances in SOFT_DELETED
state and delete them if they are only old enough. The quotas will be
committed when the instance was soft-deleted so that resource can
be used right after the soft-delete operation.
There are some concern about the quota inconsistency for the operation,
The only case that the quota might be inconsistent is
the compute node died between set instance state to SOFT_DELETED
and quota commit to DB; when compute node start again
it will have no idea the reservation is committed or not or even
expired, since it's a rare case, so marked as todo.
There are some alternatives if the problem need to be fixed, e.g.
able to find reservation when nova compute restart, so we can double
check whether the quota is committed or not.
Partial-Bug: #1296414
Change-Id: Idf9c179b2dd439462a646568ffd5098cd5d7851f

openstack%2Fhorizon~master~Ib6c5f83845e0056865a8ace82d9e2f4351d4be3e,openstack/horizon,master,bug/1288419,Ib6c5f83845e0056865a8ace82d9e2f4351d4be3e,AttributeError at attaching a non-existent volume,MERGED,2014-04-30 16:04:33.000000000,2014-07-23 04:49:54.000000000,2014-07-23 04:49:53.000000000,4,8,7,91402,41a24434d005f5b391de24d9c6ad62dc818a56d7,64,15,5,1,9449,Vernica Musso,vamusso,AttributeError at attaching a non-existent volume

openstack%2Fnova-specs~master~Ie71699e845e14251233efc993a690713f1118c31,openstack/nova-specs,master,bp/rbd-clone-image-handler,Ie71699e845e14251233efc993a690713f1118c31,Copy-on-write cloning for RBD-backed disks,MERGED,2014-04-30 23:14:10.000000000,2014-07-23 04:44:37.000000000,2014-07-23 04:44:37.000000000,222,0,14,91486,8ff7ded755fb7285976e577f8ccab12693d25ad0,64,15,8,1,8787,Dmitry Borodaenko,angdraug,Copy-on-write cloning for RBD-backed disks
Currently RBD-backed ephemeral disks are created by downloading an image from
Glance to a local file, then uploading that file into RBD. Even if the file is
cached, uploading may take a long time, since 'rbd import' is synchronous and
slow. If the image is already stored in RBD by Glance, there's no need for any
local copies - it can be cloned to a new image for a new disk without copying
the data at all.
blueprint rbd-clone-image-handler

openstack%2Fhorizon~master~Ie04699d1fb1d4db13a7f4dcf1bdfd23bf21aab80,openstack/horizon,master,bug/1323811,Ie04699d1fb1d4db13a7f4dcf1bdfd23bf21aab80,Tolerate service catalog and endpoint connection errors,MERGED,2014-07-10 16:44:15.000000000,2014-07-23 04:39:20.000000000,2014-07-23 04:39:19.000000000,60,21,2,106101,407c17b38a05580ea2117e215efa86c541b584f6,29,6,4,14,9647,Justin Pomeroy,jpomero,Tolerate service catalog and endpoint connection errors
This is a fix for the issues encountered when a service is not
configured or a service endpoint is not reachable. This fix
will add tolerance for these errors so that an error message is
displayed but the dashboard page will still load, not an error page.
This makes it easier for the user to recover by allowing them to
go to a different page, select a different region, or logout. This
makes sense in many cases such as when a region only contains an
image service endpoint, or when a single endpoint is not reachable
for whatever reason.
It also adds permissions to the panels that require compute or
image services so that the dashboard will not display them if
the service is not configured.
To test these changes you will need to set up your keystone service
catalog so that not all services are available in all regions, or
some of the service endpoints are not reachable.
Change-Id: Ie04699d1fb1d4db13a7f4dcf1bdfd23bf21aab80
Closes-Bug: 1323811
Closes-Bug: 1207636

openstack%2Fnova~master~I96242717afa5c928f1cfb5f307b71739f2147e69,openstack/nova,master,bp/libvirt-domain-listing-speedup,I96242717afa5c928f1cfb5f307b71739f2147e69,libvirt: remove flawed get_num_instances method impl,MERGED,2014-07-07 11:21:43.000000000,2014-07-23 04:19:23.000000000,2014-07-23 03:44:34.000000000,0,4,0,105128,d455a4d62e269a642f7c1fd4365096d171811d38,107,12,8,1,1779,Daniel Berrange,berrange,libvirt: remove flawed get_num_instances method impl
The get_num_instances method impl simply asks libvirt
how many running domains there are. This is flawed for
a number of reasons.
- It doesn't filter out 'Domain-0' on Xen
- It doesn't count inactive instances
As a result the value is returns is inconsistent with
the number of instances shown by 'list_instances'.
This will cause the _sync_power_states method in the
compute manager to constantly try to re-sync the list
of instances.
Remove the flawed impl and just allow the base class
default impl to be used. This just does a len() call
over the return of 'list_instances'. Previously this
was quite a heavy API call, but with new enough libvirt
it can be completed in a single API call which should
be fine.
Blueprint: libvirt-domain-listing-speedup
Change-Id: I96242717afa5c928f1cfb5f307b71739f2147e69

openstack%2Fmanila~master~I9579ecd538e29d478dbc12adc7dcc33fc668b397,openstack/manila,master,bp/testr-with-unittests,I9579ecd538e29d478dbc12adc7dcc33fc668b397,Refactor test framework,MERGED,2014-07-16 11:28:58.000000000,2014-07-23 01:28:12.000000000,2014-07-23 01:28:12.000000000,584,162,11,107323,16a04df3d0da5d6f51b7572c9fe2794c0bd718c1,42,7,8,14,8851,Valeriy Ponomaryov,vponomaryov,Refactor test framework
Manila's test framework is pretty old and requires update.
Changes:
- usage of nose replaced with testr
- now all the tests are thread safe
- added new options for run_tests.sh, such as --concurrency, --debug, etc...
- new '--concurrency' option for run_tests.sh defaults to 1, examples:
./run_tests.sh  # will run in 1 thread
./run_tests.sh --concurrency 2  # will run tests in 2 threads
- added tools/colorizer.py for colorizing output of testrun with run_tests.sh
- tests running with tox use as much threads as cores available by default
- examples of testrun with tox:
tox  # will run test suites defined with 'envlist' in tox.ini, now it is pep8,py26,py27
tox -epy27  # amount of threads is equal to amount of cores
tox -epy27 -- --concurrency=2  # amount of threads is 2
tox -epy27 -- --concurrency=4  # amount of threads is 4
- Added 'Database' class to manila.test module, for more conveniant db testing
- updated policy file 'manila/tests/policy.json' to allow share-network actions
- removed nose-related requirements
- added new requirements for testrepository, subunit
With merge of this change all old installed virtual environments become
incompatible and should be removed with ""rm -rf .tox .venv"" before testrun.
Implements blueprint testr-with-unittests
Change-Id: I9579ecd538e29d478dbc12adc7dcc33fc668b397

openstack%2Fswift~master~Id1858c97805d3ab81c584eaee8ce0d43d34a8089,openstack/swift,master,fix_lock_file,Id1858c97805d3ab81c584eaee8ce0d43d34a8089,lock_file race fixes,MERGED,2014-07-21 08:50:23.000000000,2014-07-23 00:23:56.000000000,2014-07-23 00:23:56.000000000,95,18,0,108309,b908a65649cbdd0ed5d09d11fb635c36b5f35bc1,12,4,1,2,2828,Michael Barton,redbo,lock_file race fixes
I attempted to use this function and found a few problems.
We shouldnt unlink the file after closing it, because someone else could lock
it in between.  Switch to unlink before close.
If someone else locked the file between our open and flock, they are likely to
unlink it out from underneath us.  Then we have a lock on a file that no longer
exists.  So stat the filename after locking to make sure the inode hasn't
changed or gone away.
We probably shouldnt unlink the file if we time out waiting for a lock.  So
move that to before the finally block.
Change-Id: Id1858c97805d3ab81c584eaee8ce0d43d34a8089

openstack%2Fnova~master~Icd22ff3f438b8ba476f2637c7d4129ea6d0f45e8,openstack/nova,master,bye-bye-image-service-stubs,Icd22ff3f438b8ba476f2637c7d4129ea6d0f45e8,Correct use of nova.image.glance in compute API,MERGED,2014-07-20 17:29:47.000000000,2014-07-22 23:40:28.000000000,2014-07-22 23:40:26.000000000,138,94,0,108249,c2ec61425f0cd244de3741e22f01ec641183718a,20,10,1,6,7,Jay Pipes,jaypipes,Correct use of nova.image.glance in compute API
The nova.api.openstack.compute.images modules was using the
nova.image.glance module directly, instead of using the new,
standardized nova.image.API module.
This patch corrects that usage and updates the associated unit tests to
use mock instead of the nova.tests.api.fake.stub_out_glance() method.
Copies the nova.tests.api.fake._make_image_fixtures() call to a new
nova.tests.image_fixtures module, and corrects a number of errors in the
original function, including not returning datetime objects for
timestamp fields (as the nova.image.API returns) and ensuring that the
ID field is a string in the returned fixture dicts.
The _make_image_fixtures() function and the stub_out_glance() function
will be removed in the next patch, which fixes up the image_metadata
module, which is the last unit test that uses them.
Change-Id: Icd22ff3f438b8ba476f2637c7d4129ea6d0f45e8

openstack%2Fswift~master~I706a5b5be8002c633fe97b2429256735800a902e,openstack/swift,master,v2_endpoints,I706a5b5be8002c633fe97b2429256735800a902e,Add v2 API to list endpoints middleware,MERGED,2014-06-20 22:48:54.000000000,2014-07-22 23:33:58.000000000,2014-07-22 23:33:57.000000000,272,18,12,101665,216aaab6387cd4db63aeb51520e8c1b9c70e31a5,38,10,3,2,1179,Clay Gerrard,clay-gerrard,Add v2 API to list endpoints middleware
The new API adds better support for storage policies and changes the
response from a list of backend urls to a dictionary with a key
endpoints"" that's a list of of the backend urls and a new key headers
that's a dictionary of headers to send along with the backend request.
In the v2 response format for object requests, there the headers key
includes ""X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index"" which indicates the storage
policy index for the endpoints returned in the response.

openstack%2Fpython-ceilometerclient~master~I1b286adf63b1ca05ec4fcfb27fbc939aa662cc7e,openstack/python-ceilometerclient,master,bug/1324470,I1b286adf63b1ca05ec4fcfb27fbc939aa662cc7e,Improve --debug logging output,MERGED,2014-06-24 01:23:07.000000000,2014-07-22 23:23:53.000000000,2014-07-22 23:23:52.000000000,3,1,1,102076,617f7f87cb19210382902ece612ba1d4e89ecde7,27,8,2,1,8290,liusheng,LiuSheng,Improve --debug logging output
This change makes the following improvements to the output of a
ceilometer command with the --debug option set:
* Silences spurious logging from iso8601 and urllib3.connectionpool
* Removes the line number from the logging format, since the intent
of --debug is to show the user what network requests are occuring.

Closes-bug: #1324470

openstack%2Ftempest~master~I3bf75d6f526bdc58e64bbc7d83911e9d63e4b801,openstack/tempest,master,cli,I3bf75d6f526bdc58e64bbc7d83911e9d63e4b801,Make sure cli CommandFailed prints out stdout and stderr,MERGED,2014-07-18 09:39:10.000000000,2014-07-22 23:10:04.000000000,2014-07-22 23:10:03.000000000,66,40,0,107947,7a2cf01f8b629c5b40def151780ddadb6d9d3416,19,7,2,10,1849,Joe Gordon,jogo,Make sure cli CommandFailed prints out stdout and stderr

openstack%2Fneutron~master~If3d8d98096a8363b216707f2558e37c80f58e515,openstack/neutron,master,bug_nsx_delete_network,If3d8d98096a8363b216707f2558e37c80f58e515,NSX: remove unnecessary checks on network delete,MERGED,2014-07-08 23:23:28.000000000,2014-07-22 23:09:55.000000000,2014-07-22 23:09:54.000000000,3,37,0,105622,ef3222d09030b5e25ed558179f9c7faab7f8e256,38,22,1,1,261,Salvatore Orlando,salvatore-orlando,NSX: remove unnecessary checks on network delete
Since commit b50e66f router interfaces are not deleted
automatically when the network hosting them is deleted.
The NSX plugin still has additional logic to ensure all the
corresponding backend resources have been deleted as well.
Such logic is now obsolete and can be removed. Moreover it
also wasteful as it perform queries for retrieving NSX
resource identifiers.
This patch also amends a few related log statement to make
them clearer.
Closes-Bug: #1339401

openstack%2Fnova~master~I16a48e6913f52baa870e04196529fda619c03098,openstack/nova,master,cloudpipe_errorcode,I16a48e6913f52baa870e04196529fda619c03098,Fix error status code for cloudpipe_update,MERGED,2014-07-16 09:16:04.000000000,2014-07-22 23:09:42.000000000,2014-07-22 23:09:40.000000000,13,3,0,107266,cb1e37caf174ed65c23b5fd51b28586a859291a9,25,10,2,2,6167,Ken'ichi Ohmichi,oomichi,Fix error status code for cloudpipe_update
When passing bad body in a request, most APIs return BadRequest response.
However, cloudpipe_update API doesn't do it.
This patch fixes the error status code and adds a unit test related to
this change.

openstack%2Fnova~master~I5e78b47e6f4c7359a7f0c16898a26e3649d92eb2,openstack/nova,master,cloudpipe_errorcode,I5e78b47e6f4c7359a7f0c16898a26e3649d92eb2,Fix unit tests related to cloudpipe_update,MERGED,2014-07-16 09:16:04.000000000,2014-07-22 23:09:28.000000000,2014-07-22 23:09:25.000000000,2,2,0,107265,908f2cf457376b50918581cb859cf7f50883d466,19,8,2,1,6167,Ken'ichi Ohmichi,oomichi,Fix unit tests related to cloudpipe_update

openstack%2Fnova~master~If50c9f613dd192ab44577f26a81dd5b40e3a7af7,openstack/nova,master,bp/compute-manager-objects-juno,If50c9f613dd192ab44577f26a81dd5b40e3a7af7,add get_by_metadata_key to AggregateList object,MERGED,2014-06-25 06:42:42.000000000,2014-07-22 23:09:13.000000000,2014-07-22 23:09:11.000000000,67,9,5,102446,a167654eb3c67bd8b2d0c31614da013dfbfdf183,68,10,6,5,4690,melanie witt,melwitt,add get_by_metadata_key to AggregateList object
This change adds the get_by_metadata_key function to the AggregateList object
and the aggregate_get_by_metadata_key function to the DB API.
Previously, the only DB API function available for finding aggregates matching
a metadata key returned a dictionary of aggregated metadata. The
aggregate_get_by_metadata_key function returns all rows matching the specified
metadata key, and is called by the existing aggregate_host_get_by_metadata_key
DB API function.
The get_by_metadata_key function returns a list of Aggregate objects matching
the specified metadata key.
Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno
Change-Id: If50c9f613dd192ab44577f26a81dd5b40e3a7af7

openstack%2Fkeystone~master~I88350e93d9b060f6100309a6e980ef00a4ef3928,openstack/keystone,master,bp/ephemeral-pki-tokens,I88350e93d9b060f6100309a6e980ef00a4ef3928,Use CMS to decode PKI tokens,ABANDONED,2014-02-14 02:13:08.000000000,2014-07-22 23:05:08.000000000,,102,97,0,73477,34041f0d3ab68e1390de96372db3ad8342bde730,12,2,2,7,2903,Morgan Fainberg,mdrnstm,Use CMS to decode PKI tokens
Due to the need to pass PKI token ids (not the short IDs) to the backend
the cache layer no longer support toggling the use of key_manglers. Now
the AuthContext middleware and the PKI token provider should now decode
the PKI token data instead of reconstructing the tokens each time. The
only exception to the regeneration rule is if a V2 token is validated
against the V3 API and vice-versa due to the differences in token
data.
DocImpact
bp: ephemeral-pki-tokens

openstack%2Fdiskimage-builder~master~I8f1138f58d0046ccdeefa3decc45c36d95c6bf4b,openstack/diskimage-builder,master,enable-serial-console,I8f1138f58d0046ccdeefa3decc45c36d95c6bf4b,Explicitly name element enable-serial-console,MERGED,2014-05-08 10:31:23.000000000,2014-07-22 22:23:36.000000000,2014-07-22 22:23:35.000000000,17,10,0,92805,7e58968779bb902361a30e690d4a7d4963551e70,71,11,5,8,951,Cian O'Driscoll,dricco,Explicitly name element enable-serial-console

openstack%2Fironic~master~Icfbaa4d6cdb9cbe0c392bf3dbd50ad980c70560c,openstack/ironic,master,bp/ipxe-boot,Icfbaa4d6cdb9cbe0c392bf3dbd50ad980c70560c,Rename/update common/tftp.py to common/pxe_utils.py,MERGED,2014-06-30 17:15:00.000000000,2014-07-22 22:23:29.000000000,2014-07-22 22:23:29.000000000,261,225,13,103595,a9d7a6567fb89ac59b5d1eb1df3cfee662268f98,54,7,8,8,6773,Lucas Alvares Gomes,lucasagomes,Rename/update common/tftp.py to common/pxe_utils.py
The functions in the common/tftp.py are not related to TFTP, the
functions are PXE related and most of them are used to generate the
PXE configuration file. Moving it from tftp.py to pxe_utils.py will make
it less confusing and is also needed by the iPXE work since iPXE doesn't
generate any configuration file under the TFTP folder.
The dhcp_options_for_instance() method was updated to not receive the PXE
boot file image from the parameters and just get it from the configuration
because we were always using the value from the configuration anyway.
Implements: blueprint ipxe-boot
Change-Id: Icfbaa4d6cdb9cbe0c392bf3dbd50ad980c70560c

openstack%2Fnova~master~I52f1e86815cc2cac8dc31865f00eef2d4ffeea59,openstack/nova,master,bug/1311778,I52f1e86815cc2cac8dc31865f00eef2d4ffeea59,Remove unneeded calls in test_shelve to start instances,MERGED,2014-07-22 01:10:43.000000000,2014-07-22 22:18:41.000000000,2014-07-22 20:38:41.000000000,0,23,2,108546,1fb727876fff2f796de6442730527556c16a347e,24,9,3,1,8430,Christopher Lefelhocz,leif,Remove unneeded calls in test_shelve to start instances
During running of tox the system can timeout on slower systems.  This
is due to rpc calls to other threads failing in testing.  This
particular case involved shelving calls to start instances.  However,
when we started using objects, these calls became unnecessary for these
unit tests.  Thus we are removing the calls which should remove
the traceback for slow systems.
Change-Id: I52f1e86815cc2cac8dc31865f00eef2d4ffeea59
Partial-Bug: 1311778

openstack%2Ftripleo-heat-templates~master~I9649ee74ebaf62b6b929b28243a07c789a08867c,openstack/tripleo-heat-templates,master,vlan,I9649ee74ebaf62b6b929b28243a07c789a08867c,Define and bind a public virtual IP,MERGED,2014-06-20 07:30:31.000000000,2014-07-22 22:14:04.000000000,2014-07-22 16:28:34.000000000,70,1,19,101438,5def125573552ec34b0d4a837873b1e91c4e295d,114,11,22,1,9453,James Polley,tchaypo,Define and bind a public virtual IP
Prior to this change our heat templates define one virtual IP, which all
the services are bound to.
We wish to be able to segregate these endpoints: some need to be
accessible to ""the public""; some are only intended to be accessed within
the cloud; some are only for admin use.
This change adds a second VIP which we can use for binding only the
endpoints that are intended to be publicly accessible, leaving the older
VIP to be used for internal end points.
Haproxy is told to also listen on that new VIP so that we can expose selected
services via the new VIP, and keepalived is in charge of assigning the VIP to
control plane nodes.
This change has a proposed split of services between control-only and
control+public interfaces. Assuming our yaml parsers (in merge.py and
Heat) understand YAML anchors/aliases, and assuming I've got the syntax
right, this should get expanded so that all the control+public services
get their config defined from the same block without needing to repeat
it for each service. (AFAICT both merge.py and heat use pyyaml, which
does support aliases/anchors)
The default is left at binding to only the controlplane interface, so
that new services added to this map will default to being internal-only
This patchset partially completes a spec which will one day live at
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tripleo/+specs/tripleo-juno-virtual-public-ips
but for now can bee seen in  Id9addc65f0d2ed519ce4b3edbd561ed660a2786e
Implements: blueprint tripleo-juno-virtual-public-ips
Change-Id: I9649ee74ebaf62b6b929b28243a07c789a08867c
Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>
Partial-Bug #1325114

openstack%2Ffuel-astute~stable%2F5.0~I2b71ec429ac1982f3df585423ca0818b294d8210,openstack/fuel-astute,stable/5.0,,I2b71ec429ac1982f3df585423ca0818b294d8210,Wipe each partition for all disks when removing nodes,MERGED,2014-07-17 20:49:27.000000000,2014-07-22 21:16:06.000000000,2014-07-22 21:16:06.000000000,7,0,0,107826,6db5f5031b74e67b92fcac1f7998eaa296d68025,11,4,1,1,8829,Ryan Moe,rmoe,Wipe each partition for all disks when removing nodes
If partitions are not wiped then old formatted filesystems
will show up if a parititon is created at the same point as
the previous one. This will cause ceph-deploy to fail when
bringing up an OSD. Ceph will see an XFS filesystem and the
correct partition GUID and auto-mount the partition prior to
activating the OSD.
Change-Id: I2b71ec429ac1982f3df585423ca0818b294d8210
Closes-bug: #1323343
(cherry picked from commit 9f1e69aa3a2fe7a6093fa50596d6931826d93a09)

openstack%2Ftempest~master~Ia91e432608ac25f3472478c65f9f7700bbf589e0,openstack/tempest,master,force-delete-volume,Ia91e432608ac25f3472478c65f9f7700bbf589e0,Fallback to force-delete of volumes if regular delete times out,ABANDONED,2014-06-06 18:33:25.000000000,2014-07-22 21:12:53.000000000,,43,4,0,98489,b7bd183dff32029a4c674059b0d6772018acf739,9,7,1,4,6873,Matt Riedemann,mriedem,Fallback to force-delete of volumes if regular delete times out
Attempt to force-delete a volume if the regular delete times out in the
hopes that forcing the delete will actually remove the volume rather
than leak it and cause other test runs to fail.
This is only changing the non-admin tests for now to see if it helps
with stability, but a longer term consideration should happen for
refactoring the regular volume delete client calls with defaulting to
force-delete if they timeout, then we don't need this try/except logic
in every volume API test doing this same tear down.
Related-Bug: #1322011
Change-Id: Ia91e432608ac25f3472478c65f9f7700bbf589e0

openstack%2Fpython-glanceclient~master~I8f2d89802ecbb03d79e804149424216a7e13a032,openstack/python-glanceclient,master,bug/1341777,I8f2d89802ecbb03d79e804149424216a7e13a032,WIP: Set size  for session connection pools,ABANDONED,2014-07-16 20:51:19.000000000,2014-07-22 21:11:03.000000000,,12,1,0,107495,c6ba9c7cbda9d3220af62c8a103b78a6f00650f9,11,2,3,1,6873,Matt Riedemann,mriedem,WIP: Set size  for session connection pools
This adds a connection pool adapter in the non-ssl
case and sets pool_maxsize on the session.

to see if it helps with avoid cases where the connection

openstack%2Fnova~master~I2755c59b4db736151000dae351fd776d3c15ca39,openstack/nova,master,bug/1250751,I2755c59b4db736151000dae351fd776d3c15ca39,Improve shared storage checks for live migration,MERGED,2014-05-02 02:11:12.000000000,2014-07-22 20:50:31.000000000,2014-07-16 02:17:59.000000000,337,208,107,91722,bc45c56f102cdef58840e02b609a89f5278e8cce,457,24,37,15,8787,Dmitry Borodaenko,angdraug,Improve shared storage checks for live migration
Due to an assumption that libvirt live migrations work only when both
instance path and disk data is shared between source and destination
hosts (e.g. libvirt instances directory is on NFS), instance disks are
removed from shared storage when instance path is not shared (e.g. Ceph
RBD backend is enabled).
Distinguish cases that require shared instance drive and shared libvirt
instance directory. Reflect the fact that RBD backed instances have
shared instance drive (and no shared libvirt instance directory) in the
relevant conditionals.
UpgradeImpact: Live migrations from or to a compute host running a
version of Nova pre-dating this commit are disabled in order to
eliminate possibility of data loss. Upgrade Nova on both the source and
the target node before attempting a live migration.
Closes-bug: 1250751
Closes-bug: 1314526
Co-authored-by: Ryan Moe <rmoe@mirantis.com>
Co-authored-by: Yaguang Tang <yaguang.tang@canonical.com>
Signed-off-by: Dmitry Borodaenko <dborodaenko@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I2755c59b4db736151000dae351fd776d3c15ca39

openstack%2Fnova~master~If863cf813dddc1e4554fb87b945c68b75b25f9a2,openstack/nova,master,bug/1340834,If863cf813dddc1e4554fb87b945c68b75b25f9a2,libvirt+lxc: Unmount guest FS from host on error,MERGED,2014-06-24 19:09:13.000000000,2014-07-22 20:38:58.000000000,2014-07-22 20:38:56.000000000,90,53,13,102324,60c90f73261efb8c73ecc02152307c81265cab13,73,13,6,2,475,Rick Harris,rconradharris,libvirt+lxc: Unmount guest FS from host on error
If an error occurs during `_create_domain`, we need to ensure that the guest's
FS is unmounted from the host in all cases.
This is necessary because, if we leave the FS mounted to the host, the
`lvremove` triggered by `delete` won't work because the filesystem will
'still be in use'.
The solution is to wrap the code in a `try/finally` to ensure the cleanup
routines (which unmount) are always called.
Change-Id: If863cf813dddc1e4554fb87b945c68b75b25f9a2
Closes-Bug: 1333827

openstack%2Fneutron~master~Ib71b8a3a866f5781b57d1589741bcaae594b76db,openstack/neutron,master,bug/1233339,Ib71b8a3a866f5781b57d1589741bcaae594b76db,Bump min required version for dnsmasq to 2.63,MERGED,2014-07-08 07:06:42.000000000,2014-07-22 20:38:32.000000000,2014-07-22 20:38:31.000000000,21,18,1,105378,38085c07ed32711aa427b66cd19c3e1f2df834aa,62,28,2,2,4395,Aaron Rosen,arosen,Bump min required version for dnsmasq to 2.63
This patch bumps the min version requirement from 2.59 to 2.63

openstack%2Fhorizon~master~I8bc70805aae50a019da3915f8e7aff25f6a7bbc6,openstack/horizon,master,bp/trove-incremental-backup,I8bc70805aae50a019da3915f8e7aff25f6a7bbc6,Add support for trove incremental backups,MERGED,2014-07-14 20:00:58.000000000,2014-07-22 20:35:14.000000000,2014-07-22 20:35:13.000000000,173,17,7,106855,e34fd6758ed32c20df2a6ee50c7eda352f5883fd,23,4,3,9,9750,Andrew Bramley,abramley,Add support for trove incremental backups
Added extra column to backups tables (under instances
and under backups) that will show Yes / No if the
backup is incremental (ie it has a parent)
When you drill down into backup details we now display
the name of the backup parent if this is an
incremental backup. This is displayed as a link with
the backup name so it is navigable
When you create a new backup you can now specify
an existing backup to use as the parent
Note: At some point we should probably have the
create backup dialog filter the available parents
based on the current selection for the instance.
However, so far I haven't worked out how to make
the backup parent choiceField change dynamically
based on user updates to the instance choiceField
Change-Id: I8bc70805aae50a019da3915f8e7aff25f6a7bbc6
Implements: blueprint trove-incremental-backup

openstack%2Fironic~master~Iab0d0f1c05474bf341828a2e5aba95715bf71d82,openstack/ironic,master,review/107316,Iab0d0f1c05474bf341828a2e5aba95715bf71d82,Import fixes from Nova scheduler reviews,MERGED,2014-07-16 10:54:57.000000000,2014-07-22 20:28:43.000000000,2014-07-22 20:28:43.000000000,136,47,63,107316,d0629b25b88aa7344617e3079891838f3d32f283,75,8,10,6,8125,Michael Davies,mrda,Import fixes from Nova scheduler reviews
Import fixes from the Nova scheduler driver review, based upon
revision 4 of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/103165
- create BaseBaremetalHostManager class
- import and refactor the BaremetalHostManager
- refactor IronicHostManager

openstack%2Ftripleo-image-elements~master~I41c0a2327fb5e9ff17bb187585faf146aa5506c5,openstack/tripleo-image-elements,master,iptables-option-ordering,I41c0a2327fb5e9ff17bb187585faf146aa5506c5,Put iptables arguments in correct order,ABANDONED,2014-07-22 20:19:40.000000000,2014-07-22 20:23:46.000000000,,2,2,0,108828,c6d55fde750a25badb0684e2113ac548f7d90e28,5,2,1,2,9453,James Polley,tchaypo,Put iptables arguments in correct order

openstack%2Fdiskimage-builder~master~I443ac7244f3297586466f55ead38af340f78ce7d,openstack/diskimage-builder,master,dhcp-all-interfaces.d,I443ac7244f3297586466f55ead38af340f78ce7d,Switch to interfaces.d on Debianish systems.,ABANDONED,2014-05-12 21:57:17.000000000,2014-07-22 20:02:04.000000000,,11,5,3,93364,b35c83353bcd9cd8e4431ac3fbe10ba351402118,18,5,1,1,6449,Chris Jones,cmsj,Switch to interfaces.d on Debianish systems.

openstack%2Ftripleo-incubator~master~Iccc562ad16bf73118739cd4535abfac099834e3e,openstack/tripleo-incubator,master,shift-bm-networks,Iccc562ad16bf73118739cd4535abfac099834e3e,Move updating the BM networks to a new script,MERGED,2014-07-04 00:30:07.000000000,2014-07-22 19:58:31.000000000,2014-07-22 19:58:30.000000000,60,4,0,104724,af5a36eec450aad86049fa13068835c4fccc426d,28,5,5,3,9369,Steve Kowalik,stevenk,Move updating the BM networks to a new script
Currently, devtest_testenv will write the BM networks stanza into
the TE_DATAFILE, and since you can not run devtest_testenv inside
a test environment since it plays with VMs and so on, it makes it
impossible to change the network topology described by bm-networks.
To make it easy to update in a test environment, move the population
call to a separate script.
Change-Id: Iccc562ad16bf73118739cd4535abfac099834e3e

openstack%2Fhorizon~master~I13c709f6171f8e7214b8a3ef15ddf441806df4c2,openstack/horizon,master,bug/1342266,I13c709f6171f8e7214b8a3ef15ddf441806df4c2,Add a proper IPv4 sorter for jquery-tablesort,MERGED,2014-07-15 18:26:13.000000000,2014-07-22 19:50:37.000000000,2014-07-22 19:50:36.000000000,37,1,2,107140,7b68ebe2e34ed9d0a1ea0672721c397b9d3f4106,39,6,5,1,5280,Nicolas Simonds,nicolas.simonds,Add a proper IPv4 sorter for jquery-tablesort

openstack%2Ffuel-main~master~I58af30d29399c70b9f5d142d3c495710f05994f2,openstack/fuel-main,master,bug/1336233,I58af30d29399c70b9f5d142d3c495710f05994f2,Sync time on nodes before checking Ceph health,MERGED,2014-07-21 16:57:48.000000000,2014-07-22 18:37:57.000000000,2014-07-22 18:37:56.000000000,24,6,2,108434,7d8a35fdff32146306c11ff8b76c1b63cbb08a80,59,7,10,4,11081,Artem Panchenko,apanchenko,Sync time on nodes before checking Ceph health

openstack%2Fmonasca-notification~master~Iea0d75c88c5ba67e84196e28350e355d5d79538b,openstack/monasca-notification,master,,Iea0d75c88c5ba67e84196e28350e355d5d79538b,bump version 1.0.1,MERGED,2014-07-22 17:49:53.000000000,2014-07-22 18:31:50.000000000,2014-07-22 18:31:50.000000000,1,1,0,108785,72e4a18b9d8f616948b55d923a55a3baa34f6a7e,7,2,1,1,11094,Tim Kuhlman,kuhlmant,bump version 1.0.1
