openstack%2Fceilometer~master~Ie7ac92aebb45fc23d6134b4d6693f8a1e4d4ea40,openstack/ceilometer,master,bp/ironic-notifications,Ie7ac92aebb45fc23d6134b4d6693f8a1e4d4ea40,Implement consuming ipmi notifications from Ironic,MERGED,2014-07-08 15:21:36.000000000,2014-07-22 18:14:09.000000000,2014-07-22 18:14:08.000000000,1195,0,59,105486,41e927622ec7d2b028de0a95a12a385477fe900a,81,12,14,7,11564,Chris Dent,chdent,Implement consuming ipmi notifications from Ironic
This borrows heavily from the compute notifications code. The basic
idea is that there are few classes of samples that can be had
(Fan, Temperature, Voltage, Current). Within these are potentially
multiple individual sensors and values. In all cases the volume and
unit of a sample can always be extracted from the value of a
'Sensor Reading' key. The volume is cast to a float. If the value
is 'Disabled' the data is dropped.
Each subclass exists to allow flexible handling via stevedore, but
all activity is performed in the superclass.
The supplied good test data is the currently blessed sample from the
Ironic team. The bad test data tickles either skipping missing data or
producing warnings in the log.
Identifier and name construction is worth a close look because this
is an area of frequent discussion:
* resource_id is composed from node_uuid and sensor id
* meter name is based on the class name and is generic, only
paired with a resource_id does it identify a specific sensor
* unit is parsed out of sensor data and mapped to SI units
Change-Id: Ie7ac92aebb45fc23d6134b4d6693f8a1e4d4ea40
Implements blueprint ironic-notifications

openstack%2Ftripleo-incubator~master~I0ec217ee1d20ee02fc51c30d1d2d2529bb4b3d47,openstack/tripleo-incubator,master,use-new-register-nodes,I0ec217ee1d20ee02fc51c30d1d2d2529bb4b3d47,Symlink register-nodes into scripts, and use it",MERGED,2014-06-16 07:08:44.000000000,2014-07-22 18:12:00.000000000,2014-07-22 18:12:00.000000000,3,80,0,100163,ec34f0eb47c9129a7017c03a565e58349d353766,15,4,2,4,9369,Steve Kowalik,stevenk,"Symlink register-nodes into scripts, and use it

Change-Id: I0ec217ee1d20ee02fc51c30d1d2d2529bb4b3d47

openstack%2Fnova~master~I4cd1631b8e6ec2dc3fae1f8eb0362aecead53f1e,openstack/nova,master,fix-interfaces-whitespace,I4cd1631b8e6ec2dc3fae1f8eb0362aecead53f1e,xenapi: Use netuils.get_injected_network_template,MERGED,2014-07-11 15:43:59.000000000,2014-07-22 17:03:06.000000000,2014-07-22 17:03:03.000000000,12,102,0,106409,ffd71a6c120aa1700f263c26f030445ed2579052,43,14,3,3,475,Rick Harris,rconradharris,xenapi: Use netuils.get_injected_network_template
The Xen driver duplicates quite a bit of code used to inject the `interfaces`
template into the guest.
This patch makes the Xen driver use the generic `netutils` version.
Parameter defaults were moved from the signature into the method since in the
original code, you wouldn't be able to override them due to their value being
populated at import-time, not run-time.
Change-Id: I4cd1631b8e6ec2dc3fae1f8eb0362aecead53f1e

openstack%2Fceilometer~master~I3b0e40fa3bbddc304d3adf936626334342288a2d,openstack/ceilometer,master,bp/ceilometer-meter-fwaas,I3b0e40fa3bbddc304d3adf936626334342288a2d,Support for metering FWaaS,MERGED,2014-07-14 21:39:45.000000000,2014-07-22 17:02:55.000000000,2014-07-22 17:02:54.000000000,304,0,2,106877,daf92b6bf47c92ecfbf754e81ff51827652e3199,16,4,3,6,6924,Pradeep Kilambi,pkilambi,Support for metering FWaaS

openstack%2Fnova~master~I18062b81e50c722ec96b4296ac39384493683ae3,openstack/nova,master,bug1333654,I18062b81e50c722ec96b4296ac39384493683ae3,Do not process events for instances without host,MERGED,2014-07-01 12:38:21.000000000,2014-07-22 16:53:56.000000000,2014-07-22 16:53:53.000000000,63,25,28,103865,4f8ccd7b95c27180a1cfe689e3c6f46bde5f803b,75,14,6,3,261,Salvatore Orlando,salvatore-orlando,Do not process events for instances without host
In some cases Neutron might send events such as 'VIF unplugged'
for instances which are either being deleted or shelved. When
that happens there will be a failure in dispatching the event
to the appropriate compute node - as there is no host for the
instance.
As multiple neutron events can be stashed in a single call
it is important to avoid that this kind of errors will prevent
processing of other events in the same call.
This patch does not process events for instances without a host,
marking them as failed.
When the above condition occurs, the create event request will
return a 207 response code. For specific events, a 422
unprocessable entity code will be set.
This patch also preserve the characteristic that events are
returned in the response in the same order they were found in
the request.
Closes-Bug: #1333654

openstack%2Fdiskimage-builder~master~I6322b8b529e31fd1b7251dd9e07cc85f442f7e81,openstack/diskimage-builder,master,,I6322b8b529e31fd1b7251dd9e07cc85f442f7e81,Cleanup apt cache after grub install,MERGED,2014-07-15 17:57:32.000000000,2014-07-22 16:50:43.000000000,2014-07-22 16:50:43.000000000,9,9,0,107128,ab2d1a31f2177b26aada075201712b0061a1b771,31,9,3,2,395,Endre Karlson,endre-karlson,Cleanup apt cache after grub install

openstack%2Fceilometer~master~I4d454e98974438438c166051451b76ce9fbbc2a4,openstack/ceilometer,master,network_services_discovery,I4d454e98974438438c166051451b76ce9fbbc2a4,Use resource discovery for Network Services,MERGED,2014-07-01 17:42:46.000000000,2014-07-22 16:37:22.000000000,2014-07-22 16:37:21.000000000,287,67,19,103956,68402375740ccc31ca6b4977938765ac66b966f6,51,7,9,8,6924,Pradeep Kilambi,pkilambi,Use resource discovery for Network Services

will also be more HA friendly to distribute work across
multiple central agents.

openstack%2Fkeystone~master~Ibbabdd0013059d5720250816764021a0b3ce8ce0,openstack/keystone,master,nkinder/bug/1335437,Ibbabdd0013059d5720250816764021a0b3ce8ce0,Implicitly ignore attributes that are mapped to None in LDAP,MERGED,2014-06-28 15:10:04.000000000,2014-07-22 16:37:07.000000000,2014-07-22 16:37:06.000000000,25,1,0,103325,10a3edb7800d380ed72fcbbaae98251998c0e2c7,23,8,1,2,9098,Nathan Kinder,nkinder,Implicitly ignore attributes that are mapped to None in LDAP
Attributes that are mapped to None in LDAP trigger a 500 error when
performing a search if they are not explicitly ignored in keystone's
configuration.  These attributes should always be ignored, even if
the admin left the attribute out of the ignore list.
Change-Id: Ibbabdd0013059d5720250816764021a0b3ce8ce0
Closes-bug: #1335437

openstack%2Fdevstack~stable%2Ficehouse~Iaf7c71854c3741a505a79037ffb8c86ace74fc27,openstack/devstack,stable/icehouse,remove_ssh_reconfig_stable,Iaf7c71854c3741a505a79037ffb8c86ace74fc27,Remove sshd reconfig from lib/ironic,MERGED,2014-07-15 20:15:14.000000000,2014-07-22 16:37:04.000000000,2014-07-22 16:37:03.000000000,2,23,0,107165,87b6fe407ea43d51366dffae076e6c7e905439a5,15,7,1,1,1420,Adam Gandelman,gandelman-a,Remove sshd reconfig from lib/ironic
The sshd reconfiguration to listen on port 2222 provides no
benefit and complicates deployment on some systems.  This removes
the reconfiguration and instead just confirms SSH connectivity.
Default SSH host and ports are left configurable, but the port now
reflects the default 22.
Change-Id: Iaf7c71854c3741a505a79037ffb8c86ace74fc27
(cherry picked from commit 867651049a07a087e619a17d05f569188032f7e0)

openstack%2Fswift~master~Ib1cc0bcf1dd7d2b689f2f26d100f9bab36880c81,openstack/swift,master,formpost_delete_at,Ib1cc0bcf1dd7d2b689f2f26d100f9bab36880c81,Add X-Delete-At/After support to FormPost,MERGED,2014-07-02 07:28:18.000000000,2014-07-22 16:36:56.000000000,2014-07-22 16:36:55.000000000,172,0,6,104101,90272a0564e3824e1199fb7e1250de124c1f34b0,35,6,5,2,7233,Matthew Oliver,mattoliverau,Add X-Delete-At/After support to FormPost
This change adds the ability to specify a X-Delete-At or
X-Delete-After attribute when using the FormPost middleware.
Here is an example of what you need to add to the form:
<input type=""hidden"" name=""x_delete_at"" value=""<unix-timestamp>""/>
<input type=""hidden"" name=""x_delete_after"" value=""<seconds>""/>
To be inline with the other form imput names, x-delete-at/after has
changed to x_delete_at/after.
DocImpact
Change-Id: Ib1cc0bcf1dd7d2b689f2f26d100f9bab36880c81
Closes-Bug: #1065522

openstack%2Fkeystone~master~I1e1dc8e5ac3ad766f05444b16d56a22c89602b9f,openstack/keystone,master,validator,I1e1dc8e5ac3ad766f05444b16d56a22c89602b9f,Initial implementation of validator,MERGED,2014-04-10 01:30:51.000000000,2014-07-22 16:36:48.000000000,2014-07-22 16:36:47.000000000,329,0,82,86483,95850c01c1610e943bfae5583c5f19c01186ad48,186,15,29,6,5046,Lance Bragstad,ldbragst,Initial implementation of validator
This is the initial implementation of a jsonschema type
validator for the Keystone API. Something very similar to this is used
in Nova V3 for validation. By using jsonschema to validate API requests,
we can make parameters that are passed in fit the criteria we allow and
what is specified in the Identify API spec. This will also allow us to
validate parameters by wrapping the method that needs validation.
bp: api-validation
Change-Id: I1e1dc8e5ac3ad766f05444b16d56a22c89602b9f

openstack%2Frequirements~master~I52c695086b90a94eab2ab92533665b44f00b9077,openstack/requirements,master,,I52c695086b90a94eab2ab92533665b44f00b9077,Revert oslo.messaging 1.4.0.0a3 and oslo.config 1.4.0.0a2,MERGED,2014-07-18 16:14:57.000000000,2014-07-22 15:25:24.000000000,2014-07-21 16:22:00.000000000,2,2,0,108055,5ab09ed27c34c4fa003917baec3bf366a7ce1f26,14,8,1,1,1247,Mark McLoughlin,markmc,Revert oslo.messaging 1.4.0.0a3 and oslo.config 1.4.0.0a2
This reverts commit 7916d6cb041960750604e91dd768f03700ff845d and
commit 7c6ea39940380738b4b969ed4c1b11e45ecd2055.
The oslo alpha releases are only published as wheels because we
don't want to expose them to icehouse users who may still be using
pip 1.3 which doesn't know to ignore alphas.
We recently switched to bandersnatch based pypi mirror to allow
us to mirror these wheels.
However, the py26 unit test jobs on centos6 are failing because
an old version of virtualenv and pip is installed. The failure looks
like:
Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement oslo.config>=1.4.0.0a2
Monty has been working on a fix, but it's proving to be a whack-a-mole
situation with each fix showing up yet another issue. Let's remove
the alphas for now so that the auto-proposing bot isn't proposing
changes which we know are going to fail.

openstack%2Fheat~master~Id1fb89c92af48777b0487015d5048af34b33af76,openstack/heat,master,bug/1342593_2,Id1fb89c92af48777b0487015d5048af34b33af76,Pass user_creds_id into nested stacks,MERGED,2014-07-16 18:03:50.000000000,2014-07-22 14:02:24.000000000,2014-07-22 14:02:23.000000000,45,7,0,107456,88568e64005018527c45b1e3e6286094a098c89c,21,7,2,5,4328,Steven Hardy,shardy,Pass user_creds_id into nested stacks
To avoid creating additional user_creds entries for every nested
stack, pass in the parent/owner stack user_creds_id.  This means
updates will work with trust-scoped tokens, and will remove the
overhead of creating a new trust for every nested resource.
This will also avoid the potential situation where a stack has been
updated (adding nested stacks) by a user other than the original
stack owner - if that happened, it would be impossible to delete
the stacks (owner and nested) as any user other than an admin,
due to restrictions on who can delete the trust.
Note the delete logic is modified so nested stacks no longer delete
the user_creds ID.  If we stick with this simple logic, it will
mean it's necessary to either delete all stacks before upgrading
or do a manual DB query to clean up any orphaned user_creds rows
when existing nested stacks are deleted (such a cleanup is probably
already necessary due to the previous patch fixing user_creds
handling for backup stacks)
Also modifies the stub_keystoneclient test call to make stubbing
the client in the parser test easier.
Change-Id: Id1fb89c92af48777b0487015d5048af34b33af76
Closes-Bug: #1342593

openstack%2Frequirements~master~I376bddc78242f2fd559eb80856587c2c4d64b875,openstack/requirements,master,bug/1343029,I376bddc78242f2fd559eb80856587c2c4d64b875,Bump up the zake requirement to 0.0.26,MERGED,2014-07-17 00:18:05.000000000,2014-07-22 13:42:03.000000000,2014-07-22 13:42:03.000000000,1,1,0,107537,4614fe2300a353aff5ab63c54fbe4469369b95ef,22,3,5,1,1297,Joshua Harlow,harlowja,Bump up the zake requirement to 0.0.26
Zake was released with a new version with bug fixes
and a addition of the emulation of one more of the
kazoo methods (transaction check support).
This change helps make it possible to test the fix
for bug 1343029 without requiring a full zookeeper
setup to test.
The zake *noteable* changes (for those interested):
- Add travis 3.4 builds
- Add more concurrent transaction tests
- Add much more robust transaction support
- Add basic check transaction support + tests
- Create all parent paths and child paths in the same lock context
- Address concurrent client variable modification
- Move znode making function to storage
- Add link to kazoo readthedocs
- Add test + fix for empty custom versions being provided
- Fix custom version in 'stat' response
- Ensure all paths are normalized before storage interaction
Change-Id: I376bddc78242f2fd559eb80856587c2c4d64b875

openstack%2Fpuppet-nova~master~If22b27f5fb78ba6821f4d6e8c275f8b80c70dd59,openstack/puppet-nova,master,,If22b27f5fb78ba6821f4d6e8c275f8b80c70dd59,Don't manage the nova uid/gid if nova_{user,group}_id is undef",MERGED,2014-07-03 13:47:53.000000000,2014-07-22 13:19:37.000000000,2014-07-22 13:19:36.000000000,42,26,2,104550,d850c3ceb4d2101078a75385d52c69b3a352776b,41,13,6,5,11166,Lukas Bezdicka,xbezdick,"Don't manage the nova uid/gid if nova_{user,group}_id is undef
Any user modification before standard system package creates the
user is wrong. Usecase of patch adding the user is also broken as
there are several other options: provide user before whole class
nova, have user id enforced by package or as most humans do accept
that in multi host enviroments there are 3 layers - user, group and
netgroup. In all cases nova puppet module should never touch the
user as it's provided by package on all supported systems, but for
backwards compatibility the management of user is disabled if
nova_group_id is undef or if nova_user_id is undef.
Closes-Bug: rhbz#1115946
Change-Id: If22b27f5fb78ba6821f4d6e8c275f8b80c70dd59

openstack%2Fneutron~master~Ib61756e3bd5866318cbc3bb9856344571399d656,openstack/neutron,master,bug/1344266,Ib61756e3bd5866318cbc3bb9856344571399d656,NSX: fix router ports port_security_enabled=False,MERGED,2014-07-18 19:18:13.000000000,2014-07-22 13:10:37.000000000,2014-07-22 02:25:26.000000000,4,2,3,108134,25f1439ff356f78ab0d28a74dfc75d50e2f030b6,72,24,4,2,4395,Aaron Rosen,arosen,NSX: fix router ports port_security_enabled=False
Previously there was a bug that resulted in a security group being
added to router ports which was not supported in NSX. Removing the
security group didn't actually completely solve the problem as we
never cleared the allowed_address_pairs on the router port. This
patch fixes this issue by disabling port_security_enabled on the
router port.
Closes-bug: 1344266
Related-bug: 1329043

openstack%2Ftripleo-image-elements~master~Idf3c642614699cf3f79aefd7434b3eb4983df1ae,openstack/tripleo-image-elements,master,106463,Idf3c642614699cf3f79aefd7434b3eb4983df1ae,Run migrations from only the bootstrap host,MERGED,2014-07-11 18:36:36.000000000,2014-07-22 13:02:44.000000000,2014-07-22 13:02:43.000000000,70,33,0,106463,025110241e08087bbead80ab4cef78f0e345244c,36,8,5,30,1420,Adam Gandelman,gandelman-a,Run migrations from only the bootstrap host
This ensures database migrations only happen on one node.  It moves database
migration from post-configure.d to configure.d within individual service
elements and protects all 'db sync' call with an os-is-bootstrap-host check
until we have a better story regarding leadership checks.  Also removes all
redundant 'db sync' calls from the boot-stack element (they were not actually
being run there, anyway).
Change-Id: Idf3c642614699cf3f79aefd7434b3eb4983df1ae
Closes-bug: #1339047

openstack%2Ffuel-library~master~I5ab348be6c9590a9317211178ca4cff4bb152be2,openstack/fuel-library,master,master,I5ab348be6c9590a9317211178ca4cff4bb152be2,Use full plugin class paths for Neutron,ABANDONED,2014-06-30 10:35:44.000000000,2014-07-22 12:01:09.000000000,,1,1,0,103510,86b35aa5dc95522e4def82ed3314ad26c65b091d,14,8,1,1,7604,Sergey Kolekonov,skolekonov,Use full plugin class paths for Neutron

openstack%2Fnova~master~I5c221eef8f05c66ac2e2fb4abf645748407462c0,openstack/nova,master,fix_virt_bdm_set_get,I5c221eef8f05c66ac2e2fb4abf645748407462c0,Fix virt BDM __setattr__ and __getattr__,MERGED,2014-07-03 12:40:15.000000000,2014-07-22 11:33:38.000000000,2014-07-22 08:02:02.000000000,2,6,0,104538,9cea7ad36c3512b854beda5bd226a57e65884d7a,43,10,1,2,5511,Nikola Dipanov,ndipanov,Fix virt BDM __setattr__ and __getattr__
Previously we would only allow these to work on fields that are found in
the _proxy_as_attr collection of the object and we would unconditionally
raise an AttributeError otherwise.
This behaviour is too restrictive as it prevents us from using mock on
these objects properly, Instead we now delegate back to the parent
class for a more natural behaviour.
Change-Id: I5c221eef8f05c66ac2e2fb4abf645748407462c0

openstack%2Fneutron~master~I720d7d04f6e3453145e888d9e4d9b5e381d0f7d4,openstack/neutron,master,bp/provider-network-partial-specs,I720d7d04f6e3453145e888d9e4d9b5e381d0f7d4,Add partial specs support in ML2 for gre/vxlan provider networks,MERGED,2014-02-17 14:39:49.000000000,2014-07-22 11:22:20.000000000,2014-07-22 01:08:55.000000000,157,78,21,74055,c9fd72a8e1c6a0b936e0c6d00285c0b9764108d5,297,34,22,5,8124,cbrandily,cbrandily,Add partial specs support in ML2 for gre/vxlan provider networks
ML2 provider networks partial specs let admins choose some provider
network attributes and let neutron choose remaining attributes. This
change provides the implementation for GRE/VXLAN provider networks.
In practice, for GRE/VXLAN provider networks provider:segmentation_id
choice can be delegated to neutron, in such case neutron will try to
find a network in tenant network pools which respects provided
provider attributes.
DocImpact

openstack%2Fheat~master~I7f27910e0ec877738998ff80c44e12d3bd4bfa7b,openstack/heat,master,bug/1297938,I7f27910e0ec877738998ff80c44e12d3bd4bfa7b,Stop coercing provider res. attributes to strings,MERGED,2014-07-17 10:01:26.000000000,2014-07-22 11:02:02.000000000,2014-07-22 11:02:01.000000000,40,1,0,107621,83657cf1eb0eb07f14a0186ce6105dc25c783658,17,7,2,2,4330,Tomas Sedovic,tomas-8c8,Stop coercing provider res. attributes to strings
Attributes of a resource defined in another template were
automatically converted to a string. If a provider resource returned
{""ip"": ..., ""name"": ...} as an attribute value, it was converted to
This fix makes the behaviour consistent with the way stack outputs and
native resource work (i.e. can return strings, lists and maps).
Closes-Bug: #1297938
Change-Id: I7f27910e0ec877738998ff80c44e12d3bd4bfa7b

openstack%2Fnova~master~I19432cb93bc1471118d9d323c712cdd9756a5926,openstack/nova,master,bp/libvirt-driver-domain-metadata,I19432cb93bc1471118d9d323c712cdd9756a5926,libvirt: define XML schema for recording nova instance metadata,MERGED,2014-06-27 12:12:32.000000000,2014-07-22 10:35:55.000000000,2014-07-22 10:32:27.000000000,173,8,0,103108,bf02f134d711a040b117788009843e7edc9f3040,46,12,4,2,1779,Daniel Berrange,berrange,libvirt: define XML schema for recording nova instance metadata

a metadata block to provide information about the instance
that is being run. When querying the libvirt guest XML this
is visible thus:

<nova:flavor name=""m1.small"">

<nova:disk>20</nova:disk>
<nova:swap>0</nova:swap>

</nova:owner>

</domain>

openstack%2Fnova~master~I87449ffddd047cb84b7b881757ea4c29927b95da,openstack/nova,master,master,I87449ffddd047cb84b7b881757ea4c29927b95da,Libvirt: Added suffix to configdrive_path required for rescue,MERGED,2014-06-25 21:03:01.000000000,2014-07-22 10:13:38.000000000,2014-07-22 07:25:50.000000000,171,4,2,102645,0d781d41fef329294891fdda0c1dac4add5ce7c3,139,10,5,3,8515,Shraddha Pandhe,spandhe,Libvirt: Added suffix to configdrive_path required for rescue
It was observed that during nova rescue, nova failed to create
a rescue disk for disk.config. The reason being that .rescue
suffix was missing from the configdrive path. It was working
till Havana but the functionality broke in Icehouse. This commit
fixes the suffix problem.
Unittests have been added to verify following scenarios:
1. Make sure that .rescue disks are created when not using
config drive
2. Make sure that .rescue disks are created when using
config drive
Closes-Bug: #1334024
Change-Id: I87449ffddd047cb84b7b881757ea4c29927b95da

openstack%2Fnova~master~I531dea5a5499bf93c24bea37850d562134dee281,openstack/nova,master,bug/1319182,I531dea5a5499bf93c24bea37850d562134dee281,VM in rescue state must have a restricted set of actions,MERGED,2014-05-19 23:04:28.000000000,2014-07-22 10:13:03.000000000,2014-07-22 08:02:17.000000000,52,8,5,94281,8ff170dc95bf3101fe38a2624e941bfa3b7c1138,156,18,4,3,9275,Leandro Ignacio Costantino,lcostantino,VM in rescue state must have a restricted set of actions
Right now it is possible to pause, suspend and stop a VM in state RESCUED,
so after the state is changed, it's not possible to trigger unrescue anymore
since the original state is lost.
This patch remove vm_states.RESCUED as valid state from stop,
pause and suspend actions.
The vm_states devref is also updated to reflect this change including the
current reboot flow.( vm_states.RESCUED cannot be rebooted as per
today code)
DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1319182
Co-Authored-By: Cyril Roelandt <cyril.roelandt@enovance.com>
Change-Id: I531dea5a5499bf93c24bea37850d562134dee281

openstack%2Fceilometer~master~I83020b13670928fd0d3046d2d2a493b11fe81d61,openstack/ceilometer,master,bug/1317210-amalgamated-dependencies,I83020b13670928fd0d3046d2d2a493b11fe81d61,Separate the console scripts,MERGED,2014-07-21 07:17:39.000000000,2014-07-22 09:50:47.000000000,2014-07-22 09:50:46.000000000,244,92,0,108294,ab0c18e5d4074085e2006e3daec902c018a23b8a,22,6,1,10,8052,Nejc Saje,nsaje,Separate the console scripts
Having all the console scripts in one file means that we always pull
in all the dependencies. This presents a problem in downstream packaging,
for example, a distro alarm subpackage required pymongo dependencies
installed, even if not used.
This patch separates the console scripts into a 'cmd' module, the
way Nova does it. Eventlet monkey patching is done in the module's
__init__.py file.
Co-Authored-By: Mehdi Abaakouk <mehdi.abaakouk@enovance.com>
Closes-bug: #1317210

openstack%2Fpython-keystoneclient~master~I52a37bbc129fab40a99c919a837147d663941dce,openstack/python-keystoneclient,master,use_immutable_arg,I52a37bbc129fab40a99c919a837147d663941dce,Use immutable arg rather mutable arg,MERGED,2014-07-01 08:42:56.000000000,2014-07-22 09:50:39.000000000,2014-07-22 09:50:39.000000000,3,1,4,103801,4766d168ba4c86eef8a6bd04eeb0401ab2e33cd5,23,10,1,1,6763,jingliuqing,jing,Use immutable arg rather mutable arg
Passing mutable objects as default args is a known Python pitfall.
We'd better avoid this. This commit changes mutable default args with
None, then use 'arg = arg or []'.
Change-Id: I52a37bbc129fab40a99c919a837147d663941dce

openstack%2Fsahara-specs~master~Ia48cd573f4c3ca9a7cbe1edb652f7a27b03615f9,openstack/sahara-specs,master,bp/edp-swift-trust-authentication,Ia48cd573f4c3ca9a7cbe1edb652f7a27b03615f9,[EDP] Using trust delegation for Swift authentication,MERGED,2014-07-03 18:53:49.000000000,2014-07-22 09:27:02.000000000,2014-07-22 09:27:01.000000000,295,0,22,104647,67838672a05048abeebd37f2bd8aba1d87678384,54,9,7,1,10670,Michael McCune,mimccune,[EDP] Using trust delegation for Swift authentication
For access to Swift objects, Sahara should be changed to generate a
Keystone trust between the user with access to those objects and the
Sahara admin user. The trust would be established based on the users
membership in the project that contains the Swift objects. Using this
trust the Sahara user could generate authentication tokens to access the
Swift objects. When access is no longer needed the trust can be revoked
thus invalidating the tokens.
blueprint edp-swift-trust-authentication
Change-Id: Ia48cd573f4c3ca9a7cbe1edb652f7a27b03615f9

openstack%2Fdevstack~master~I828cb331dfb578889c66eff6ed76bde6be65b20c,openstack/devstack,master,master,I828cb331dfb578889c66eff6ed76bde6be65b20c,Set osapi_compute_extensions default value,ABANDONED,2014-04-26 17:04:16.000000000,2014-07-22 09:20:21.000000000,,1,0,0,90553,f5b9ce00b61beb1940378a194f8c3e637cf217bf,10,5,2,1,7494,Guangya Liu,JayLau,Set osapi_compute_extensions default value
The Devstack commit 3317437caca5eb769ab4c6d3ea7c5d3e062517e2 removed
the osapi_compute_extensions configuration option from lib/nova.
This caused a bug of Climate 1312368, I think that we should not remove
default value of osapi_compute_extension from devstack in nova as this
value is a multiple string option. Once the default value is removed,
then when we add another value of osapi_compute_extension in nova.conf,
the default value of nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.standard_extensions
will be overwritted and this will causes a lot of HTTP 404 at Nova API.
Change-Id: I828cb331dfb578889c66eff6ed76bde6be65b20c

openstack%2Fsahara-specs~master~I4e9460b6ae70cd14e858070b56c7f1eff4cdd077,openstack/sahara-specs,master,bp/aims,I4e9460b6ae70cd14e858070b56c7f1eff4cdd077,Storm Integration,MERGED,2014-07-09 16:20:55.000000000,2014-07-22 09:10:05.000000000,2014-07-22 09:10:05.000000000,170,0,18,105784,f5f4f5f263ec8b5e9eec7cf800fb6747001cd891,38,9,5,1,8932,Telles Mota Vidal Nbrega,tellesnobrega,Storm Integration

openstack%2Foslo.db~master~Ibd9847ec40ff0b4fa2ee2a36a2ea728771ade80b,openstack/oslo.db,master,bug/1283987,Ibd9847ec40ff0b4fa2ee2a36a2ea728771ade80b,Add protection for Query deadlock in sqlalchemy,ABANDONED,2014-05-04 07:48:11.000000000,2014-07-22 08:53:17.000000000,,15,7,2,92002,01da52d223a7ca9a7186d40db26af5f1b4802155,18,8,2,1,8021,wingwj,wingwj,Add protection for Query deadlock in sqlalchemy
The function '@_wrap_db_error' and '@retry_on_dead_lock',
is only available for session deadlock(query/flush/execute).
But it doesn't cover some 'Query' actions.
So, we need to add the same protection for 'all()' in sqlalchemy.
Change-Id: Ibd9847ec40ff0b4fa2ee2a36a2ea728771ade80b
Closes-Bug: #1283987

openstack%2Ftripleo-image-elements~master~Idccc0d60c9f6b17a853c6de1bbea64bfc7e028b2,openstack/tripleo-image-elements,master,feature/read_glance_port,Idccc0d60c9f6b17a853c6de1bbea64bfc7e028b2,Read glance protocol, port for glance_api_servers",MERGED,2014-04-03 15:48:03.000000000,2014-07-22 08:35:10.000000000,2014-07-22 08:35:10.000000000,3,1,5,85082,6af5b94ec1878c4335aa792961cfc577a9a2b819,66,10,3,2,7133,Ryan Moore,moory,"Read glance protocol, port for glance_api_servers
Currently glance_api_servers is being in nova.conf set as
glance_host:9292
It should be:
glance_protocol://glance_host:glance_port
to allow inclusion of SSL setting (of https) for protocol
Currently glance_port is hardcoded and protocol is assumed,
this change reads the value set in the yaml configuration file.
Change to the yaml file to put the value in as configurable is:
Depends on: I5fe952f850339465de128e56e45c9bbda011ce7f
Change-Id: Idccc0d60c9f6b17a853c6de1bbea64bfc7e028b2

openstack%2Fnova~master~I28ce23509e3c9feae183a49a8fc5bf3c7c601295,openstack/nova,master,fakevirt2,I28ce23509e3c9feae183a49a8fc5bf3c7c601295,Make hypervisor_version an int in fakeVirt driver,MERGED,2014-02-26 17:02:01.000000000,2014-07-22 07:36:08.000000000,2014-07-22 05:27:51.000000000,28,26,4,76582,026583e60e9ec2b83049e8ceee16f182560d2562,140,17,6,25,1849,Joe Gordon,jogo,Make hypervisor_version an int in fakeVirt driver
This is a follow up to 9e770e62135fe9c2c8ac0121a5a79245b25a7847, which
missed the change in a duplicate copy of host_status.
Add regression test to test_virt_drivers.
This requires changes to the API samples, because they were wrong. virt
drivers use convert_version_to_int which converts a version string to a
4 digit number (""1.0"" becomes to 1000)

openstack%2Ffuel-library~master~Ia1891593f57de6533da0479074423fd0b73e7f52,openstack/fuel-library,master,fix-glance,Ia1891593f57de6533da0479074423fd0b73e7f52,Set glance control_exchange to 'glance',ABANDONED,2014-07-22 06:23:11.000000000,2014-07-22 07:28:17.000000000,,2,0,0,108588,705e7b95e4b5a4f10b2c40dd6034cbd00f1aeb16,8,3,1,1,9387,Aleksandr Didenko,AD,Set glance control_exchange to 'glance'
Glance control_exchange in glance-api.conf wasn't set
and glance used default value for this - 'openstack'.
So, exchange 'glance' and queue 'glance' didn't exist in rabbit.
But ceilometer as default glance control exchange uses 'glance'.
This patch fixes the fix for this problem and change-id as well
Closes-bug: #1335891
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
